string.text: \nMikhalych asked me to find some lost devices. Landmark — an old column of military vehicles, somewhere in the eastern part of the Tesla Zone.
Why are you squinting like that, wanted something?
I've got a proposal for you. There's a small problem. If you help us—well, me specifically—solve it, I'll be able to reward you properly.
What kind of problem? And I'd also like to know right away what "properly reward" actually means.
A certain Professor Sakharov came to me—the one at Yantar, sitting there in his tin can. The thing is, two rather valuable devices were lost in that damned Tesla Zone.
Got it… And about the second question?

Alright, listen up. You already know that artifacts have different properties. Some are a bit better, some a bit worse. Take a "Medusa" for example—there's one that pumps out radiation like crazy, but helps against telepathy and other nasty stuff, and then there's another that radiates like hell and doesn't protect from anything at all. Still, a "Medusa" is a "Medusa" anywhere you go. Beyond the Border they won't really care whether it irradiates or not. It's here, in the Zone, that it matters for a regular stalker—you'd rather it protect your ass without frying you with radiation.\nThat's where the business comes in: if you want a better artifact, you come to me, give me two slightly worse ones, and I give you one—but a better one. So, are you in?

Uh-huh… So I bring you two good artifacts, and you give me one excellent one? Got it… If I agree, where do I look for Sakharov's devices? Tesla isn't the kind of place where you can wander around all day, poking under every bush.
No, I'll manage without it.

Sharp kid. Got it right away… They were lost somewhere in Sector Twenty-Three. A rough landmark is a column of military vehicles in the eastern part of Tesla. The devices aren't very heavy—about five kilos each. I've already talked to a few stalkers about this problem, but it seems to me that you've got, how should I put it… a sense of responsibility.
Your loss, but that's your choice.
I'll try to look for them, but no promises.
Mikhalych, I found those damn "devices".
Well I'll be damned, you made it back. I thought you were done for already… They don't irradiate, do they? That's the last thing we need.
No, doesn't look like it. These "devices" look more like containers. Maybe there's something valuable inside?
Containers or not, what's it to you? Whether there's something inside or not—that's for Sakharov to figure out. Our job was just to find them. Got it?
Alright then, take them. Let them sort it out themselves.
Yeah, seems they're not irradiating. Interesting, really interesting… What were they trying to haul out of Tesla that they sent a whole army column in there?
So they really are containers?!
That's none of your concern. Here's your reward for running around, and you can start collecting artifacts. Bring them to me, I'll trade.
Not exactly generous… You can tell right away whose godfather you've got.
\nSidorovich asked me to find out about Duty's supply routes. In return, he promised a good suit with a mask. Need to go to the Bar and talk to Plichko.
Sidorovich, I've got urgent business.
Where you running to? The Zone isn't a stadium. Out here you walk, watch your step, and keep your head on a swivel.
No time for jokes… I need a suit, with a gas mask—better yet, a full mask. Got to head down into some catacombs, and the gas down there is brutal.
Decided to play at being a digger? Didn't happen to hire yourself out as Mole's assistant, did you?
Don't have one. Ask around at the Bar, or go talk to the military at Agroprom.
I need to check something in the underground tunnels at Agroprom. Supposedly Strelok had a base there. Maybe something's still left… maybe I'll find something, remember something.

Very interesting… And the military set up shop there too. I don't believe in coincidences like that. Looks like there really is something there we don't know about yet. Hm… You need a suit? Then buy a jacket with a gas mask—brand new. Oh, and grab a canteen too, for wiping the glass.
A jacket's fine, sure, but I need something more serious, with a roomy backpack. I'm not going down there with just a pistol—and what if there's some kind of beast?

Hmm… something more serious… I do have a very good outfit for you, with a big backpack. Not new, but still. It's called the "Tourist" suit. Exclusive piece, by the way. They don't make them like that anymore—craftsmen have gone downhill. Vergas is still puffing along, sure, but who knows how much time the Zone's given him.
And what do you want for such a "valuable" item? I take it you're not giving it away out of the kindness of your heart.
And how did you guess?! There's a small problem. Need to clear up a situation—take a trip to the Bar, to a certain someone, and ask him a few questions.
And he'll want something extra on top of that… Scientists already taught me that lesson, without you.
Alright, tell me what needs to be done.
Suit yourself, Marked One. I made the offer—you refused.

Then listen up. Lately, facts have been surfacing that Duty's main needs are being supplied through some kind of secret channel. None of the stalkers know—or are willing to share—who supplies Duty, how, or with what. As far as I can tell, even the Barkeep isn't really in the loop! That kind of situation could come back to bite us traders, who are bound by mutual agreements on currency and the list of staple goods.\nIt'd be best to clear this up as soon as possible. I've got an acquaintance among the Dutiers who can be carefully leaned on about these "phantom caravans." So what do you say? Will you go have a talk with our "planted Cossack"? If you manage to sort this out, then… my gratitude won't leave you empty-handed.
Any chance I could get part of that gratitude up front, you know, for the road?
Unbelievable… You know the way to the Bar? Then go—everything will be arranged there. His name's Plichko, just so you know.
Yeah… guess I'll go.
Hey there, soldier. Holding the line?
Well hello! Looking to sign up with us? Good gear, food till you're stuffed… weapons are a bit lacking for now, sure, but otherwise—welcome aboard!
You paint a nice picture. But where do all these goodies come from anyway? Don't see any tailor workshops around here.
Don't worry, our gear isn't some local cottage-industry stuff! All factory-made. With a quality seal!
Hmm… hard to believe. So how does all that factory gear even get here?
How does it get here? That's classified business, not for public disclosure! Though…
Care to elaborate on that "though," if you don't mind?
I clocked you right away—you're not asking questions for nothing! Let's make a deal: first, you help me out with a little job. You look like a quick one, shouldn't be any trouble.
And what exactly are you talking about?

They put me in charge of defending a checkpoint, but we've got no serious firepower. The warehouse is short on "heavy artillery" right now, and the mutants—you see it yourself—come in packs. Lately they've gone completely nuts. Last night a pack of pseudodogs almost broke through, we barely made it out alive.
I get it… So what are you proposing?

Get me an RPK machine gun. Then not even a mouse will slip through—we'll mow all that filth down from a kilometer away. And you won't lose out either, the road will be a lot safer. You do a good deed, and then we'll have a nice, friendly talk about whatever it is you're interested in. Sound like a deal?
And where am I supposed to get you an RPK?!

There's a warrant officer over at Agroprom, goes by Sherstyuk. You can get proper army gear from him, straight off the warehouse shelves. He's got a real soft spot for vodka… Try to strike a deal with him. Just don't drag your feet.
If it works out, you'll get your machine gun.
Got you the machine gun—this thing's a beast.
Thanks, Marked One. You really came through!
You didn't forget about our little talk in all the excitement, did you?
And where's the ammo, huh? Bet you kept the armor-piercing rounds for yourself? What are we supposed to shoot with?
Hey, don't get your blood up—we'll load it now.
Duty pays its debts. So, what was it you wanted to find out?
Take the machine gun… And what I wanted to know was about your gear—what kind of overseas countries it's being supplied from.

Alright, here's how it is. Just don't flap your gums about it too much. Our commanders have connections in the structures of one not-so-small country. And, well… you get it? They ship various scientific devices to the big shots in the Swamps, and the crates have some clever markings on them. Our guys intercept those crates, stockpile them, and then—when needed—deliver them where they're supposed to go. Catch my drift? Here, take this suit—the manufacturer's markings are still on it, I grabbed it straight from the crate. We usually scrub those off later. And remember—I didn't tell you anything, and you didn't ask me anything!
Through the Swamps, huh… Hm… Alright, see you around.
Hey, wait up—you've bailed me out more than once now. Write this recipe down… for keeps.
If you need anything, come by.
I met with the Dutyer. Had a nice, heart-to-heart talk.
Well? Don't drag it out. Where do they get their gear from? Find out?
He let it slip that they pull it straight from the factories, under the cover of supplies for the scientists in the Swamps. Here's their armor, with the manufacturer's markings still intact.
I see… So that's where Duty's abundance comes from.\nAnd what use is… although… Yeah, it's clear enough.\nWhy are you standing there like a post?
You owe me compensation for expenses and the rest of the reward! You didn't forget, did you?
What people… Instead of sitting down for a calm, friendly chat about life, remembering the good old days… everyone's always running, rushing somewhere.
Sidorovich! Get out of your basement sometime, take a walk to the ATP, admire the scenery—you could get so many pleasant impressions… Me, I don't have the time.
Don't get smart. Here's your suit, a water flask, and some medical supplies.
Generous, didn't expect that. Though the suit is kind of… well…

Take the suit to Vergas to get it fixed up. The old man could use the spare change too. If you find anything interesting in that underground, bring it by—we'll see, maybe something mutually profitable will come of it. And don't forget about our business at Agroprom.
You're getting old, Sidor… getting old…
I need to charge a battery.
No problem. I'll charge it for you. A couple of packs of AK-74 rounds, or one pack for an AKM… What've you got?
I've got a couple of packs for an AK.
Here's a pack for an AKM.
I'm short on ammo right now.
Here you go, a charged battery. If you need anything else, come by.
Thanks, take care.
\nThe Barman asked me to look into a shipment that two stalkers agreed to deliver but never brought to the client. In return, he promised a good suit with a mask. One of them was seen at the Garbage.
Barman, I've got urgent business.
Urgent, you say? Maybe it can wait?
I need a good suit, with a gas mask—or better yet, a full mask. Got to go into some underground place, and the gas down there is brutal.
Decided to become a digger? Didn't hire yourself out as Mole's assistant, did you?
I don't have anything good. Ask Sidor, or go talk to the military.
I need to check something in the underground at Agroprom. Supposedly Strelok had a base there. Maybe I'll find something… maybe remember something.
Interesting, very interesting… And the military settled there too. All of this is strange.
I need decent armor, with a roomy backpack. Can't go down there with just a pistol—what if there's as much wildlife as in a zoo.

Hmm… decent. I do have a very good suit for you, with a roomy backpack, though it's not new. One Dutyer handed it over to settle a debt. Duty hunters sometimes wear suits like these when they go on raids against monster lairs. Reinforce them with something special. Get it? An exclusive item—almost nobody makes them like this anymore, craftsmen are getting worse. Longshanks is still puffing along, sure, but who knows how much time the Zone has left him.
And what do you want for such a "valuable" item? I take it you're not giving it away out of the goodness of your heart.
And how did you guess?! There's a small problem. Need to clear something up—go to the Garbage, to a certain person, and find out a few things.
And he'll want something extra on top… Scientists—we've been through that already. Count me out.
As you wish. Everyone chooses their own path.
Tell me what needs to be done.

Not long ago I sent two jokers to deliver a package to someone. Two for reliability, so they'd keep an eye on each other. It wasn't anything extremely important—just a couple of good artifacts in a locked container. But the delivery was urgent, and it never reached the addressee. Both of them vanished at once. It's the Zone, sure, they could've gotten into trouble. But just recently I was told one of them was spotted. So I want you to go see him and find out what's what. Maybe they resold it—which I really wouldn't like—or maybe they fell out with each other and ditched the job—I don't know. Their relationship isn't my concern; I'm only interested in business and money. You get the idea: I need them to return the contents or an equivalent value, then I'll resend the package with someone more reliable. The client's annoyed, sure, but he's still waiting for what he ordered. Bottom line—sort this out as quickly as you can. And when you're back, we'll discuss your reward.
And if they refuse? Then what?
Then do your best—I only care about the result. Remember who you're looking for.
I'll go talk to him.
I've already made my choice.
I found your couriers.
What about those screwups? What happened to the shipment?
Same old story—they got themselves into trouble. Here, take this artifact, they sent it with apologies. They promised to return the shipment contents to you before nightfall.
Good. And what kind of artifact is this? Strange one… I'll give it to the Docent, he'll sort it out. You're done, then?
I am. Where's the suit?

I set something aside for you in advance. Take the armor, a water flask, and some medical supplies. The suit's seen better days, sure—but take it to Longshanks, he'll patch it up. The man's got to earn his bread too.
Yeah… I'll go.
Stalker, you looking for someone?
Looks like I'm looking for you… The Barman sent me. Where's the shipment? Don't give me that surprised look—the container you were carrying with someone else to the client. Where is it?

Damn bad luck… I thought this would all blow over in time. Here's how it went: we had to run from a chimera, and there was that container… Heavy thing. The chimera slashed me—just the tip of a claw, glancing blow, but I still get bleeding at night. I ditched the container, figured we'd pick it up after fighting back. Then an emission started, had to look for shelter. When we came back, the container was torn open and empty. We searched the area and found a couple of rare artifacts—"Night Star." I figure some anomaly shifted after the emission and ripped the crate open, the artifacts fell out. They wouldn't have just appeared after the emission—there'd have been capsules then. And now, how do we bring a busted container to the client? And without it, the "Stars" radiate like hell. Can't go back to the Barman either—he'd skin us alive. He'd say the shipment wasn't these artifacts, but a pair of "Pendulums"—and you'd never prove otherwise… My partner said we should lie low for now, pretend we vanished. We split the "Stars," but agreed not to sell them yet, just hid them—in case we still had to return them. Looks like that time's come…

You ever heard of the Barman just letting his goods go? He wants you to return the contents or an equivalent value as soon as possible. Otherwise, he'll get pissed. Remember a simple truth: nothing ever just blows over—and when it resurfaces, it's usually too late to fix anything.

Yeah, I get it… But I've only got one "Night Star," the other's with my partner. And I've got to go to my stash for mine. Maybe you could go see my partner? While I'm running back and forth… time's already tight, like you said. What do you think?
For crying out loud, you sat around waiting for this to sort itself out… and now I've got to run around like my ass is on fire? To hell with you!
Is it far? I had my own plans.
Not really. He's usually around the Gut, seems to have hooked up with the hunters. But he might be roaming somewhere nearby.
Damn it… Who am I looking for, then?
Help me out, brother, I'll remember it for life. My buddy's a dark-haired guy:
Uh-huh… off I go.
Any news, or are you just passing through?
Just passing through.
I found your buddy. We talked… sharp guy. He promised to come see you tomorrow and bring his share. Also said to pass along apologies to the Barman from you, as I understand it—something material.

Ah… well… I've got something. Left over from previous runs. Not quite an artifact, seems to have no properties, but I've heard scientists are very interested in these. Pass it on to the Barman from us, he'll sort it out.
Hurry up with the shipment—time's ticking…
Anything else?
Stalker, looking for someone?

You, pal. I'm here from your partner—the one you botched the Barman's delivery with. You catch what this smells like? That's right. You need to return the contents, and preferably fast. Your partner went to fetch his share, so the rest is on you.
And who are you supposed to be? You've got a lot of swagger.

Name's Marked One. Been here a short while—or maybe a long one, can't remember. But I do know this: your business with the Barman won't just sort itself out. Traders have long memories… you get the idea.
Yeah… I get it, I get it. If it wasn't you, someone else would've come—meaner.
Quick learner. So grab your artifact, get to your partner, and the two of you go beg the Barman—maybe he'll forgive you.
I was thinking the same, but… I don't have that artifact anymore. When I crossed the Cordon, I sat down in the village with those Wolkhov idiots to drink and snack—and things got out of hand.

Decided to show the lads what a hotshot stalker you are—blew a good artifact just like that, and not even your own. Familiar story. You didn't just screw yourself, you set up your partner too. The Barman won't sort out who owes what—he'll want it all. What're you gonna do? You're almost out of time.

I swear, I meant to return everything… Listen, I've got an idea—will you help me? When I was boozing it up on the Cordon and bragging about the rare artifact we were drinking away, some guy told me you can supposedly brew the same one from a "Slime" and a "Stone Flower." A seasoned stalker shared the recipe with him, but he trusted his memory, didn't write it down—and of course forgot. Believe it or not, I've had a "Stone Flower" stashed away for a rainy day, and I found a "Slime" just yesterday. I thought about getting the full recipe from Tooth, but first—I'm dead broke, and second—the Bar's off-limits to me anyway. Save us, Marked One—they'll whack me and my partner both.
You finally came to your senses. Sat around waiting, and now I'm supposed to chase down a recipe for you? Get yourself out of it.
That's the thing—both of you. If not for my own interest in this… Alright. I'll pay Tooth a visit. I think the Barman will wait till I get back.
Yeah, thanks. I'll go hunt some critters in the meantime—sure something'll be useful for brewing.
Just don't get eaten yourself. Would be a fine mess if all my running around turned out to be for nothing…
Tooth, I need the recipe for a "Night Star" from a "Slime" and a "Stone Flower."
I've got it. What, forgot the other brewing components? Happens. I can dig through my notes… when I've got the time… Sheesh.
Alright—so how much?
Why jump straight to "how much"? Not everything can be bought with money… at least, not always.
Fine. Then what do you want for the recipe?

I want you to check a lead for me. Trivial stuff—probably bunk—but I need all options covered. Let's do it like this: you put down a deposit, say, ten PDAs. If you come back empty-handed, they're mine and you get your recipe. If there's a result, I return everything and throw in something extra—on top of the recipe, of course. Deal?
Trivial, you say? Uh-huh… Fine, I'll take your word. Wait here—I'll be back with the PDAs.
Sounds fishy. I think I'll pass.
About that "deposit" for your errand…
Well? Brought the PDAs?
Yeah. Take them.
No. I'm backing out. Got a bad feeling about this.

Excellent! Then listen up. You've probably seen the abandoned vehicles rusting along the roads in the Gut—especially under the ruined overpass. All of it was part of a large evacuation convoy that once hauled property out of… various places that ended up inside the Zone's perimeter. Most of that transport's been looted long ago, but every now and then you hear rumors of lucky stalkers bringing traders something new from there. Recently I got a tip about a spot where the convoy stopped—a gas station. Why do I think something interesting might still be there? I sent a man to scout it. A few days ago he reported seeing some serious-looking types poking around the station and nearby, clearly searching for something. They didn't finish, though—a big family of boars drove them off. My observer didn't dare stick his nose in after that.
Your call.
So you want me to head to the Gut and check if anything interesting's left at that gas station?

Exactly. And I reckon if there's anywhere worth looking, it's inside the building. The surroundings have been turned over a hundred times, but inside… Say someone from the convoy ducked in during the stop and hid something there—what do you think?
You're asking me? I don't even know what they were hauling. Or… are you so confident because you know more than you're saying?

You're sharp, Marked One. Yeah, I did get info from my informant—he went to the mainland to talk to one of the convoy drivers. The driver hasn't been in the Zone for ages, but he remembered that evacuation. Shared some interesting details. Riding with him in the truck was—let's call him—a courier. During the stop, he got out with a bundle, went into the gas station building, and stayed gone a while. Came back without the bundle.
So? Could've been anything in that bundle, and anything he did with it. And why do you think it hasn't been found yet? You're holding something back.

What do you think those "serious-looking" guys were sniffing around for? They likely got the same tip I did. If they had reason to believe the story, I'm not about to let it slide either. I'm not insisting the bundle will be there—but I want it checked.

Wants it checked… Feels like you're still not telling me everything, but to hell with it. I can go to the gas station and carefully search the inside. I'll even shoot some boars if they're still there. But don't expect me to dig up the whole place or check every bush around.
That's perfect. I'm not asking for more.
You bet. Don't forget—I've already put down a "deposit," and I'm not breaking my back for you beyond what's necessary for my own loot.
There are, and what kind! I'm just not sure whether for you they're simply bad… or a complete clusterf—
Here we go… You know how many times people have tried to start a conversation with me in that tone?
Aren't you afraid this one might be the last? Because I'm real tempted to put a bullet in your head for stunts like this!
Don't try to bluff me—I'm not some nobody here. Instead of yelling, you'd better tell me properly what happened.

What happened is I nearly got whacked at that gas station by those very same "serious-looking types." The place was clearly under surveillance, and as soon as I went inside, they set up an ambush on the way out. Nearly got me—barely fought my way through. For the record, I didn't find anything there except a fresh corpse in the back room, looked like an ordinary stalker. Oh, and the boars your observer warned about showed up too. So yeah, the full package of "fun."

I see… So they knew or suspected someone might come, since they were watching the place. I don't deal in cheap setups like that, Marked One—you can take my word for it. Think about it: what would I gain? A bad reputation hurts my business badly. Which means either you blabbed about my errand to someone and got yourself a warm welcome… or—which is far more likely—my informant was playing a double game. Knowing of my interest in the evacuation convoy, he could've guessed I'd hire someone to search, and shared his "ideas" with those thugs. If they hadn't found the bundle yet, he might've even fed them a story that my man would know exactly where to look. That's why they waited for you so patiently.

Hmm… sounds plausible. Let's say that's how it went. But who was that dead man in the utility room? Could it have been your informant? Found out he was playing both sides, so they slit his throat… it does line up. Either way, even if I agree to believe your version, this won't fly without solid compensation, don't you think?

Ah, so we've moved into bargaining territory—familiar ground. In case you forgot, our deal was that if you came back empty-handed, you'd get no PDAs and no extra bonuses, just the recipe. You were warned about the "gentlemen of fortune" regardless, so from my side everything's clean. What happened to you is pure force majeure.
Nothing but profiteers everywhere. One won't even tell the time for free, another would strangle you over an extra bandage. Fine, I've got you figured out. Dictate the recipe and let's be done.

Hold on, Marked One, don't boil over. I just wanted to test your reaction—see if you'd start pressing for more reward, or if keeping your word mattered more than money. You handled it right, so here's a compromise: your "deposit" stays with me, I'll upload the recipe to your PDA right now, and… here's a little extra from me—a Walther P99. I carry one myself. So, no hard feelings?
Now that's more like it. Alright, let's call it even. Take care.
Hey there! Learn the recipe, or just passing by?
I'm here on a different matter.
Alright, write this down: toss a cat's tail, a snork foot, a "Slime," and a "Stone Flower" into a Whirligig for 7–12 minutes.
You're a real man, Marked One—a real one. I even traded Ignat for some sausage, knew you wouldn't let me down. Smells awful, sure, but it barely spoils and it's filling.
Didn't trade for their moonshine too? Folks say it's lethal stuff. Heh-heh…

Still joking around… enough. I'm done with that now—quit for good. And tell my partner I'll be coming to see him no later than tomorrow. And have him pass his apologies to the Barman through you—he'll know which ones.
Where were you, such a sharp one, earlier?
Forget something?
\nSherstyuk asked me to deliver crates of provisions to the military in the Swamps. In return, he promised to get hold of an army suit with a mask.
I've got a question for you.
Pop a bottle open, and I'll answer all your questions with great pleasure. Feeling kind of gloomy today.
Not in the mood for talking late at night. Come by in the morning… and, uh… bring a bottle—for the hangover.
Why didn't I think of that before?
I always carry one with me—to flush out radiation.
That's right. There's no better medicine than the good old stuff. Helps with everything. Personally tested.
I need a suit with a mask. Can you get one? I guarantee a reward.
You need a suit? Heading north, are you? Why would you want that? You can settle in just fine here too—even as a stalker.
Let's say I am heading north. So… yes or no?
Persistent one, aren't you… You know the way to the Swamps?
No, why?
Yeah. Why?
That's bad. Find the route first—then we'll talk.

We need to get provisions to our soldiers there. They're stationed by the tower on the southern edge of the Swamps, guarding some scientists. They're complaining they're completely out of food. Folks say they're cooking soup out of jerboa heads and boar hooves. Heh-heh… just kidding, of course. Deliver a few crates to them, and then we'll talk about my suit and your reward.
What about your guards? They've got APCs and helicopters.
The barracks are full of green recruits right now. They already drowned one APC—that's enough. The rest of the main force went off on… exercises. That's classified, though. Heh-heh…
Let them deliver it when they're back. I'm not hauling heavy crates that far.
Where are the provisions? What do I need to carry?
Pity. We could've worked well together.

In a hurry, aren't you. Listen up. Swing by in a couple of hours—we need time to prepare and pack everything, you know how it is. I'll signal you when it's ready. For now, go take in the local scenery. Shoot some dogs too—not a bad deed. They've multiplied like crazy lately. And one more thing—no need to promise anything extra, I'll manage without it. I know you stalkers: lots of promises, then you're gone without a trace.
I found out the way to the Swamps.
And what do you want from me? I don't have any rubber boots.
You remember our talk about the suit with a mask?
Let's say I do. So what?
I need a suit with a mask. Can you get one? I guarantee a reward.

Guarantees, huh… And what do the Swamps have to do with it? Ah, right, I remember… I wanted you to deliver provisions to our soldiers there. They're by the tower on the southern edge of the Swamps, guarding some scientists. They're complaining they're really short on food. Folks say they're making soup out of jerboa heads and boar hooves. Heh-heh… just kidding, of course. Take them a few crates, and then we'll talk about my suit and your reward.
I'm not hauling heavy loads that far. Let your guards do it.
Where's your provisions? What do I carry?
Pity. We could've worked well together.

In a hurry, are you? Swing by in a couple of hours—we need time to prepare and pack everything, you know. I'll signal you when it's ready. It's already late, so keep in mind I need to be back at the barracks by lights-out. If you don't catch me here, come another day.\nAnd no backing out with "I changed my mind," "don't need it anymore," or "some other time." I know you stalkers—lots of promises, then you vanish. We shook on it, so be kind enough to follow through.

In a hurry, are you? Swing by in a couple of hours—we need time to prepare and pack everything, you know. I'll signal you when it's ready.\nAnd no backing out with "I changed my mind," "don't need it anymore," or "some other time." I know you stalkers—lots of promises, then you vanish. We shook on it, so be kind enough to follow through.
I'm here for the shipment for your soldiers.

Oh, you showed up?! Didn't expect that… I've prepared the shipment—there, under the bush. Canned food and other provisions. Try to deliver it quickly. Wouldn't want the commanders showing up any day now—I don't need extra trouble. And one more thing… a personal request. The soldiers there set up a small business, trading ammo for food. Tell them the brass isn't aware yet, but Sherstyuk sees and knows everything. They'll get the message. And I'm warning you—get it done, or don't show your face again. I'll be waiting for your report.
Could've tossed me something for the road… it's a long way.

Marked One, you haven't done anything yet and you're already asking for more. No need to tell me about hardships—I've been in the army a long time. For vodka—I'd give you a whole wagon, but otherwise… although… I could throw something in, if you visit a buddy of mine in the Swamps and deliver a little present. His birthday's coming up.
Hope it's not a couple of crates of vodka—I won't manage to carry that in one go.
No, no… a small barrel of good wine. Sent from the south. Want to spoil my… comrade.
If it's on the way, I'll do it. Just who am I looking for? The Swamps are big.
Maybe I'll visit your buddy some other time.

A captain at the oil pump station—Abramovich, the local one. Tell him Sherstyuk sends his regards and the gift. And that there's a delay with supplies for now—he'll understand. I'll let him know myself later, when, where, and what.
As you wish… There might not be another time. Don't forget to take the shipment!
Hand over the wine… and whatever else there is.
Here's the barrel—and something for the road… Don't forget to take the shipment!
I've completed your errands. What about our deal?
So how was it in the Swamps? Frogs croaking, mosquitoes buzzing… How are the soldiers, keeping watch? Did you deliver my gift?
So how was it in the Swamps? Frogs croaking, mosquitoes buzzing… How are our soldiers, keeping watch?

Dogs, boars, and bloodsuckers. And all sorts of smaller nasties… Did everything as agreed. The captain seemed unhappy about something, though—maybe just my imagination. The soldiers are fine, sent their regards. We talked about the suit—haven't forgotten, have you?
Dogs, boars, and bloodsuckers. And all sorts of smaller nasties… Did everything as agreed. The soldiers are fine, sent their regards. We talked about the suit—haven't forgotten, have you?
Sherstyuk remembers everything. The suit's ready—two of them, even, your choice. Now where's the vodka?
What kind of suits are they, and how much do you want for them?
For you, as a friend—just 13 bottles and the army "Berill" is yours. If you want tougher armor, I'll part with an "SKAT-9" for 20 bottles.
For you, as a friend—just 18 bottles and the army "Berill" is yours. If you want tougher armor, I'll part with an "SKAT-9" for 25 bottles.
Thirteen bottles for the "Berill," a whole crate for the "SKAT"?! Tolerable.
Eighteen for the "Berill" and twenty-five for the "SKAT"?! That's steep…
I'm here for the suit. We had a deal.
Which one did you decide to take?
I'll take the "Berill." Here are thirteen bottles, strictly by the price list.
Let's see what this "SKAT" is like. Take it—there's exactly a crate here.
I'll take the "Berill." Here are eighteen bottles, strictly by the price list.
Let's see what this "SKAT" is like. Take it—there are exactly twenty-five bottles here.
I don't have that much vodka yet.
It's not bootleg, is it? You never know…
Don't worry. Screw cap, excise stamp—you won't poison yourself.

Then take your "Berill." Factory-made, with a quality seal.\nAnd one more thing. Some unhealthy commotion's brewing—our lieutenant got pulled, and another officer arrives tomorrow. He'll most likely bring back the old duty and watch schedule, so don't look for me here every fourth day of the month. On top of that, there's a scheduled combat-readiness inspection three times a month, so I won't always be available either—you understand.

Then take your "SKAT." Factory-made, with a quality seal.\nAnd one more thing. Some unhealthy commotion's brewing—our lieutenant got pulled, and another officer arrives tomorrow. He'll most likely bring back the old duty and watch schedule, so don't look for me here every fourth day of the month. On top of that, there's a scheduled combat-readiness inspection three times a month, so I won't always be available either—you understand.
Not saying goodbye. Going to try the new gear on.
So, if I understand correctly — Marked One?
Yes, Marked One. And who might you be? Feeling a bit uneasy standing next to such a menacing stranger.
I thought your kind had nerves of steel. Major Dumenko, counterintelligence.
What do I owe the pleasure?

Warrant Officer Sherstyuk told me you agreed to help him deal with a certain problem. Judging by the fact that you're standing here now, you handled it well.\nI could also use the help of a quick and military-friendly stalker. Catch my drift? Fine, just listen for now.\nWe're currently near our base, at the former Agroprom Research Institute. Some time ago, a directive came down from above: ensure the maximum possible level of security in this area. The local commander reinforced the posts, put snipers on the towers, mined the holes in the perimeter fence, and so on — all strictly by the book, according to garrison and guard duty regulations.
And why are you telling me all this…?

At ease! Don't interrupt. I'll finish, then you'll understand where this is going.\nSo. We more or less secured the Institute's perimeter against unauthorized access, but during an inspection I discovered that there is a descent into the underground right on the base — and from there, all kinds of filth keep pouring out! We tried collapsing the passage several times — didn't help. Then I sent a group of contract soldiers down there to clear it out. Only one came back. Shaking all over, mumbling something — can't make out a damn thing. That's when the idea came to me to turn to an experienced stalker.

I see. So you don't want to send your own men anymore, but throwing a random stalker into the meat grinder is fine — no great loss, right? Want to ride into paradise on someone else's back, Major? Earn yourself a medal? And how do you even imagine this working? A group of trained soldiers couldn't handle it, but a lone stalker supposedly can?

Don't get smart with me, Marked One! I'm not sending you to finish the cleanup — I'm asking you to find out what happened to the missing soldiers. You know the difference between "missing in action" and "killed in action," don't you? For all we know, they could've gotten lost down there in those catacombs, or some anomaly isn't letting them back out — in that case, they might need help. Bottom line: I need clarity so I can understand what steps to take next.

Doesn't really put a smile on my face, poking around dark basements looking for your people, Major. What if they start shooting in panic? Assuming they're even alive. You said it yourself — plenty of monsters down there. No, you go looking for your clarity without me.
Let's assume I agree. Especially since I have my own interests in that underground. Might as well help you along the way. So, are you suggesting I use the descent on your base?

Predictable. Then get lost. And don't let me see your face again, understood? And keep this in mind — I'll warn Sherstyuk that you're on my personal blacklist. I'm sure after that he won't dare do business with you.

No, that won't do. See the ventilation shaft sticking out on the hill? You can go down there. Be warned — strict security protocols are in effect, and we regularly mine the approaches to the shaft. When you're ready, I'll order the mines to be taken off combat mode until nightfall — that is, until 21:00. At night, all threatened directions must be covered — orders are orders. If you don't make it down in time, look for another entrance. There should be one more near the eastern complex of the Institute. In short, I'm expecting you during daylight so I can give my men the go-ahead. Then we'll go over the details.
Understood. There's just one small issue: I heard that down there the air is heavily contaminated — without a proper gas mask you won't last long…

What, hinting that you don't have one? Want me to hand over my own suit? Go haggle with Sherstyuk. He'll trade you a tank for vodka if you bring him five truckloads of it. Or look within your stalker circles.
A better suit will come in handy for me sooner or later anyway. Might as well start looking for one now…
Did I warn you not to show your face again? I did. Now deal with the consequences.
And what are you doing here at this hour? We had an agreement.
I was just… passing by.
Ready to head down into the underground?
Not yet. Need to put together some decent gear.
Yes. Give me the task. Would be nice to also clarify… the size of my fee.

It's fairly simple. You need to go through as much of the underground as possible, assess the situation, and find traces of the missing soldiers. If they're alive, help them get out. If they're dead… well, carrying bodies out alone would obviously be impossible, so take their army dog tags. That way we can at least identify the fallen by their personal numbers, notify headquarters, inform the families… you understand.\nAs for the reward — don't worry about it yet, focus on the task. But I'll prepare something substantial for you, officer's word.\nOne more thing. On your way to the shaft, try not to be seen by our soldiers. They have orders to shoot at any movement. That's all. I'll be waiting for your report. Understood?
Have you already been underground and found traces of the missing soldiers? No? Then what is it?
You're back?! I was informed that you went down into the underground. Quite a bit of time passed — I was starting to think that was it for you. Did you find the missing soldiers?

I did… though there wasn't much left of them. The rats will finish the rest soon enough. Plenty of monsters down there — you were right. A whole nest of bloodsuckers settled in. In short, it's no place for people. Dark, damp, poisoned air, and death hanging in the air.\nHere — I collected the dog tags, as you asked.
Pity about the lads. Died for nothing. But bitter truth is better than ignorance — that's what I believe. Thank you, Marked One. This is for your help.
I was hoping to find my own truth down there. Instead, I've got more questions than answers. Take care.
Anything else?
Did you find out what's going on in the Gut?
I told you — you're dismissed.

While wandering through the catacombs on your assignment, I stumbled upon… something of great interest to me. Could you order your men not to mine the underground entrance on the hill during the day? It's a very convenient descent for… well, for getting around quickly, where I need to go.
You're being cagey, Marked One. Some stalker business of yours? Frankly, I don't care. Complete one more assignment and we'll call it a deal. I'll even throw in a little something for your troubles.
Well… I suppose I can give it a try. And how can I help the dear army this time?

Being ironic? Very funny.\nI assume you've been to the area known as the Gut, haven't you? Perhaps you also noticed the column of rusting vehicles near the overpass. All valuables were looted long ago, but important technical documentation was stored in fireproof cases — useless to the uninitiated. It could have survived and, according to our intelligence, until recently it was still somewhere there. I sent my men to verify this information and soon received a report that they managed to locate a sealed case, which presumably contains what we're looking for. The squad leader reported they were heading back along the northern road. That was the last transmission we received. They've been silent for several days now, and frankly, I fear the worst. Among their equipment were special GPS trackers. The last signal came from the northern part of the Gut, almost at the border with the Dark Valley. Your task is to check the area, find out what happened to the squad, and if it turns out they're all dead, locate that case and bring it to me.\nI didn't want to involve outsiders until the very end, but the remaining troops under my command are tied up in another important operation, and time is running out. I'm afraid the documents may slip away for good this time. Questions?
What if I find your soldiers, but don't find the case?

That's unlikely. You see, the squad consisted of seasoned, experienced fighters. But they're trained to fight other people, not unknown creatures. So I'm inclined to believe that humans were hardly involved in their disappearance, and mutants — as you understand — have no use for a case. Therefore, find the squad, and you'll find the case.
Sounds reasonable. All right, I'm in.
Greetings, Commander!
Don't clown around. Did you find out what happened in the Gut?

You were right about the monsters. It looks like your men ran into a Controller and its entourage. That's one hell of a creature — makes your hair stand on end. Not just on your head, either. It twists a man's brain inside out in an instant, especially if you meet it in open ground. Its entourage usually consists of zombified stalkers — very tough guys, not every bullet will stop them. Took some doing, to put it mildly. As for your men — they didn't make it. All dead…
That's more or less what I expected, though I still hoped… And the case? Did you find the case?
Of course. You were right about that too. The Controller had no use for it. Here you go.
Yes, looks like the one. Why is the seal broken?
Yes, looks like the one. Well done!
How should I know?! I brought it in the condition I found it in. Maybe the seal broke when it fell, or maybe your boys got curious. What about my request? The mines.
You can admire your briefcase later. What about my request? The mines.

Unlikely. Extremely unlikely. Seems to me you're not telling me everything, Marked One. Still, fine—the contents of the case appear to be intact, so you've completed the task. During daylight hours the passage will be open; don't try going there at night.\nThis is for you—a present. You've earned it. That's all, you're dismissed.
As agreed. During daylight hours the passage will be open; don't try going there at night.\nThis is for you—a present. You've earned it. That's all, you're dismissed.
Why so pensive, old-timer?

Ah, Marked One. Here's the thing… Lately some stalkers have been bringing in suits for repair that are soaked with some kind of chemical. I won't take on repairs like that—I'm afraid I'll only make things worse.
Why's that? You're a jack-of-all-trades.

Don't try to sweet-talk the old man. You'd be better off heading to the Swamps and finding out what those eggheads have come up with there. Might be some use in it for me, too. They say this impregnation makes a suit a lot tougher—you can carry more weight, and wear and tear is reduced.
You could've just said it's purely a commercial interest.
What commercial interest? I'm just curious what kind of clever trick they've cooked up there.
If I'm in the Swamps, I'll ask around.
I've taken care of your request.
Marked One, what are you talking about? My memory's failing me—remind me.
About the suit impregnation in the Swamps. You were curious about what they use and how.
Ah, so what did science come up with?

They soak the suits in a decoction made from zombie hands and then treat them with some kind of rays. The technology's experimental and almost classified. The suit really does get tougher, but the effect doesn't last—only three or four days… and then it's goodbye.

Zombie hands?! Thank the Zone it's not their guts. And the fact the impregnation only lasts three or four days—that's good. Won't be left without work. Here, take this kit, and stay clear of those academics. The nerve of them, coming up with something like that…
Take care, old-timer. And you said it wasn't about business.
People say you can reinforce armor?
They're already talking? Figures… Did a favor for a few stalkers and the gypsy mail's spread it everywhere. We've only just managed to apply this technology in practice.
So how much does it cost, and what exactly do you need?

Here's the thing, Marked One. Sergeich, our professor, is worried that this experimental, not fully tested method might leak out somewhere, and then some unforeseen consequences could follow. He's concerned about his reputation. I'm afraid he might shut this whole armor-reinforcement operation down. Without his approval, I won't do anything. Go talk to him yourself—maybe you'll come to an agreement.
I'll go talk to him.
Demyan, I've reached an agreement with the professor about the reinforcement.
Ivan Sergeyevich has given his approval.
What's required for that? And, if it's not a secret, what exactly did you come up with there?

Don't worry, it's not lethal. Of course, not everything is as smooth as we'd like. Let me explain:
First, the effect of the "reinforcement" doesn't last very long—three to four days at most.
Second, the compound can be obtained from the muscle tissue of a "walking dead man"—a zombie, as stalkers call them. There aren't many of those, so mass-producing the "compound" isn't possible. That's why we have to refuse many requests. Still, we do have a small supply.
Third, this procedure is quite costly. Equipment expenses, energy consumption, labor… I think you understand. A pair of first-tier artifacts or one second-tier artifact should be enough to cover the… expenses. But we only accept those in good condition—keep that in mind. It's important for our research.
So if you need it, drop by.
So it'll cost me either a couple of first-tier artifacts or one second-tier one?! And the artifacts can't be too worn, either… Did I get that right? Sounds pretty expensive.
What did you expect, Marked One? Be glad we didn't turn you away outright.
You toil and toil, and then—bam—more expenses again.
Demyan sent me to you for permission. To reinforce a suit.

You're here about that too?! What a nuisance… As an experiment, we reinforced suits for stalkers who are among our regular helpers. But I'll repeat myself—only as an experiment. The reinforcement technology is quite complex, costly, and not yet fully studied. The positive effect achieved by applying this substance to a suit turned out to be very unstable. We still don't know what impact this technology has on the person wearing the suit. That's why I don't want to put people at risk for the sake of questionable scientific achievements.
I'm agreeing voluntarily. Your conscience will be clear.

I like you, Marked One, so let's do it this way… Our graduate students always have a couple of crazy ideas—I envy their energy. Talk to them, help where you can. Unfortunately, we have few people with real survival experience in the Zone. And those we do have, how should I put it gently, tend to help us mostly out of mercantile motives. Everyone always needs something.
What did you expect, Professor? To survive in the Zone you need resources, and those usually come either for artifacts or for services. I've yet to meet anyone who gives me something for nothing.

Perhaps you're right. I find your persistence and straightforwardness appealing. Then… a favor for a favor. Talk to the graduate students—maybe one of them will offer you a job. Provide whatever assistance you can. And then we'll return to the discussion about reinforcement. Does that arrangement suit you?
It does. I'll go talk to them.
So, what about the upgrade?

I've been told you did a great deal of work. Thank you. I'll inform Demyan—he'll take care of everything. And… one more thing… Don't refuse to help our staff in the future. I've already mentioned their crazy ideas, but that's what science is built on. What once seemed fantastic is now mundane reality. We can always be useful to each other.
Who's refusing?! I'll help as much as I can.
I don't want you to misunderstand me. It's just a request.
Agreed, Professor.
Sakharov needs to obtain three "Slime" artifacts for research.
Sakharov needs to obtain three "Stone Flower" artifacts for research.
Sakharov needs to obtain three "Flash" artifacts for research.
There were messages on the network that you're interested in batches of specific artifacts.

Yes, from time to time we conduct series of various experiments for which we require certain samples. In fact, another series is scheduled to begin in the coming days. Are you interested in that kind of work? Can you find particular artifacts well and, no less importantly, quickly?
If you don't need three containers' worth at a time, I can take part.

No, not at all. Given our modest material and technical resources, we do not conduct research on such a scale. As a rule, only a few pieces are enough.\nSo, let's start with three "Slime" artifacts. I won't burden you with scientific details of the experiments' purpose—I doubt you need that. Will you take on such a trivial assignment? In return, I can offer you a recipe for a mesomodifier of the "Soul" artifact, or transfer a respectable sum to your account. And you can choose everything you need yourself. We have a fairly decent selection, as you may have noticed.

No, not at all. Given our modest material and technical resources, we do not conduct research on such a scale. As a rule, only a few pieces are enough.\nSo, let's start with three "Stone Flower" artifacts. I won't burden you with scientific details of the experiments' purpose—I doubt you need that. Will you take on such a trivial assignment? In return, I can offer you a recipe for a mesomodifier of the "Soul" artifact, or transfer a respectable sum to your account. And you can choose everything you need yourself. We have a fairly decent selection, as you may have noticed.

No, not at all. Given our modest material and technical resources, we do not conduct research on such a scale. As a rule, only a few pieces are enough.\nSo, let's start with three "Flash" artifacts. I won't burden you with scientific details of the experiments' purpose—I doubt you need that. Will you take on such a trivial assignment? In return, I can offer you a recipe for a mesomodifier of the "Soul" artifact, or transfer a respectable sum to your account. And you can choose everything you need yourself. We have a fairly decent selection, as you may have noticed.
All right, I agree.
No, this isn't for me—too complicated.

Thank you in advance for your willingness to help us. I only want to warn you right away that the artifacts must be in the best possible condition. I won't be able to accept worn ones. For the sake of experimental purity, we need a complete artifact, not its… remnants.
Come back later if you change your mind.
Understood. I'll be going—things feel uneasy around here.
Professor, could you remind me which artifacts I'm supposed to bring you?
Three "Slime" artifacts.
Three "Stone Flower" artifacts.
Three "Flash" artifacts.
Thanks for the reminder.
Here you go. All the "Slimes" are in excellent condition.
Here you go. All the "Stone Flowers" are in excellent condition.
Here you go. All the "Flashes" are in excellent condition.
I see, I see… So what should I offer you? The recipe, or 75,000 transferred to your account?
I'm interested in the recipe.
Transfer the money.
Then write it down and… come back later—perhaps we'll work together again.
Very good, and… come back later—perhaps we'll work together again.
Sakharov needs to obtain three "Meat Chunk" artifacts for research.
Sakharov needs to obtain three "Crystal Thorn" artifacts for research.
Sakharov needs to obtain three "Fireball" artifacts for research.
Professor, do you perhaps need another batch of artifacts brought in?
Marked One, you've come just in time. We really do have a need for another anomalous material.
I'm all ears.

We would be very grateful if you could obtain three "Meat Chunk" artifacts for us. Will you take it on? In return, I can offer you a recipe for a mesomodifier of the "Porcupine" artifact, or transfer a respectable sum to your account.

We would be very grateful if you could obtain three "Crystal Thorn" artifacts for us. Will you take it on? In return, I can offer you a recipe for a mesomodifier of the "Porcupine" artifact, or transfer a respectable sum to your account.

We would be very grateful if you could obtain three "Fireball" artifacts for us. Will you take it on? In return, I can offer you a recipe for a mesomodifier of the "Porcupine" artifact, or transfer a respectable sum to your account.
Sounds simple enough. I'm in.
No, this isn't for me—too complicated.
I trust I don't need to remind you about the quality of the artifacts. Thank you in advance for your willingness to help us.
Come back later if you change your mind.
I've got the idea—no need to repeat it. I'll be going.
Professor, could you please remind me which artifacts I'm supposed to bring you?
Three "Meat Chunk" artifacts.
Three "Crystal Thorn" artifacts.
Three "Fireball" artifacts.
Thank you for the reminder.
Here you go. All the "Meat Chunks" are in excellent condition.
Here you go. All the "Crystal Thorns" are in excellent condition.
Here you go. All the "Fireballs" are in excellent condition.
I see, I see… So what should I offer you? The recipe, or 75,000 transferred to your account?
I'm interested in the recipe.
Transfer the money—I'll sort it out myself.
Then write it down and… come back later—perhaps we'll work together again.
Excellent, and… come back later—perhaps we'll work together again.
Sakharov needs to obtain two "Mica" artifacts for his research.
Sakharov needs to obtain two "Crystal" artifacts for his research.
Sakharov needs to obtain two "Goldfish" artifacts for his research.
Professor, do you perhaps need another batch of artifacts delivered?
Marked One, you are just in time. We have indeed developed a need for another anomalous material.
I'm all ears.

We would be very grateful if you could obtain a pair of "Mica" artifacts for us. In return, I can offer you a recipe for a hypermodifier of the "Battery" artifact, or transfer a respectable sum to your account.

We would be very grateful if you could obtain a pair of "Crystal" artifacts for us. In return, I can offer you a recipe for a hypermodifier of the "Battery" artifact, or transfer a respectable sum to your account.

We would be very grateful if you could obtain a pair of "Goldfish" artifacts for us. In return, I can offer you a recipe for a hypermodifier of the "Battery" artifact, or transfer a respectable sum to your account.
Sounds manageable. I agree.
No, this isn't for me. Too complicated.
Thank you in advance for your willingness to help us, and I trust there is no need to remind you about the quality of the artifacts.
Come back later if you change your mind.
I get it, no need to repeat yourself. I'm off.
Professor, could you remind me which artifacts I need to bring you?
Two "Mica" artifacts.
Two "Crystal" artifacts.
Two "Goldfish" artifacts.
Thanks for the reminder.
Here you go. All the "Mica" artifacts are in excellent condition.
Here you go. All the "Crystals" are in excellent condition.
Here you go. All the "Goldfish" artifacts are in excellent condition.
I see, I see... So what shall I offer you? The recipe, or 100,000 transferred to your account?
I'm interested in the recipe.
Let's go with the money.
Then take note and... come back later, perhaps we'll work together again.
Then we have a deal, and... come back later, perhaps we'll work together again.
Sakharov needs to obtain two "Night Star" artifacts for his research.
Sakharov needs to obtain two "Sea Urchin" artifacts for his research.
Sakharov needs to obtain two "Soul" artifacts for his research.
Professor, do you perhaps need another batch of artifacts delivered?
Marked One, you are just in time. We have indeed developed a need for another anomalous material.
I'm all ears.

We would be very grateful if you could obtain a pair of "Night Star" artifacts for us. In return, I can offer you a recipe for a hypermodifier of the "Mama's Beads" artifact, or transfer a respectable sum to your account.

We would be very grateful if you could obtain a pair of "Sea Urchin" artifacts for us. In return, I can offer you a recipe for a hypermodifier of the "Mama's Beads" artifact, or transfer a respectable sum to your account.

We would be very grateful if you could obtain a pair of "Soul" artifacts for us. In return, I can offer you a recipe for a hypermodifier of the "Mama's Beads" artifact, or transfer a respectable sum to your account.
Sounds manageable. I agree.
No, this isn't for me. Too complicated.
Thank you in advance for your willingness to help us.
Come back later if you change your mind.
Yeah. Things feel uneasy around here, I'll be going.
Professor, please remind me which artifacts I am supposed to bring you?
Two artifacts: "Night Star".
Two artifacts: "Sea Urchin".
Two artifacts: "Soul".
Thank you for the reminder.
Here you go. All "Night Stars" are in excellent condition.
Here you go. All "Sea Urchins" are in excellent condition.
Here you go. All "Souls" are in excellent condition.
I see, I see... So what shall I offer you? A recipe or 100,000 transferred to your account?
I'm interested in the recipe.
Transfer the money to my account.
Then write this down and... come back later, we may work together again.
Agreed, and... come back later, we may work together again.
Sakharov requires two artifacts for his research: "Mama's Beads" and "Spring".
Sakharov requires two artifacts for his research: "Film" and "Kolobok".
Sakharov requires two artifacts for his research: "Dummy" and "Battery".
Professor, do you perhaps need another batch of artifacts brought in?
Marked One, you arrived just in time. Our series of experiments is nearing completion, and for the final stage we will need something special.
I'm all ears.

We would be very grateful if you could obtain two artifacts for us: "Mama's Beads" and "Spring". I understand that this is an extremely... costly assignment, let us call it that. Therefore, you will receive an appropriate reward: any one of the seven artifact final-stage modification recipes currently known to science. I believe stalkers call them absolute, or something of the sort. Naturally, an alternative reward option will also be available. So, will you take it on?

We would be very grateful if you could obtain two artifacts for us: "Film" and "Kolobok". I understand that this is an extremely... costly assignment, let us call it that. Therefore, you will receive an appropriate reward: any one of the seven artifact final-stage modification recipes currently known to science. I believe stalkers call them absolute, or something of the sort. Naturally, an alternative reward option will also be available. So, will you take it on?

We would be very grateful if you could obtain two artifacts for us: "Dummy" and "Battery". I understand that this is an extremely... costly assignment, let us call it that. Therefore, you will receive an appropriate reward: any one of the seven artifact final-stage modification recipes currently known to science. I believe stalkers call them absolute, or something of the sort. Naturally, an alternative reward option will also be available. So, will you take it on?
Wow! That's quite a request! On the other hand, the reward is tempting. I'm in.
No, that's a bit too much for me.
Thank you in advance for your willingness to help us.
Come back later, the offer remains open.
Uh-huh. It's uneasy around here, I'll be going.
Professor, could you please remind me which artifacts I'm supposed to bring you?
Two artifacts: "Mama's Beads" and "Spring".
Two artifacts: "Film" and "Kolobok".
Two artifacts: "Dummy" and "Battery".
Thanks for the reminder.
Here you go. Everything is in excellent condition.
Here you go. Everything is in excellent condition.
Here you go. Everything is in excellent condition.

Excellent! How would you like to be rewarded? Would you like to choose a recipe? As an alternative, I can offer you the SSP-99M "VEGA" scientific suit and a permanent discount on our entire exchange stock.
I'm interested in the "Bengal's Crystal Soul" recipe. Is that one known to you?
I'm interested in the "Giant's Tear" recipe. Is that one known to you?
I'm interested in the "Great-Grandmother Burer's Beads" recipe. Is that one known to you?
I'm interested in the "Pudding" recipe. Is that one known to you?
I'm interested in the "Stone Porcupine" recipe. Is that one known to you?
I'm interested in the "Giant's Younger Brother" recipe. Is that one known to you?
I'm interested in the "Controller's Scalp" recipe. Is that one known to you?
I'll take the suit. And make sure the discount is set up.
One moment, I'm checking…
Please accept your reward. The discount will take effect shortly, as soon as new supplies are delivered to us.
What, were you deceived after all? And they said any absolute would do…

How could you even think that? It's just that stalker terminology, to put it mildly, doesn't always match what's used in scientific circles, so we have to cross-check with the database every time. Write this down…
Alright then. Anything else you need? If not, I'll be on my way.
You've done an excellent job, Marked One. I won't keep you any longer.
\nThe Barman asked me to find his friend, a regular at the bar, and find out why he stopped coming by
I wanted to ask about a suit with a closed breathing system.
I remember, I remember. I do have something like that. But you understand, it won't be for free.
Rare merchandise, not many people ask about it. I do have something. But you understand, it won't be for free.
So when it comes to going into that damn laboratory, it's suddenly "for everyone's benefit," but when it comes to a suit, it's "not for free."

Oh, stop playing the offended one. Finding a way north is in your interests too. So calm down and listen. I've got a job for you… a personal one. I wouldn't trust it to just anyone. Take it on, and you'll get a proper suit — a real armored spacesuit.
Alright, say what needs to be done — just as long as I don't have to off anyone, you know what I mean.
I know your routine. First it's a run from one end of the Zone to the other, your ass on fire, and in the end nothing but losses from that kind of "exercise." I'll pass — I'll look elsewhere.

Not long ago, one guy used to drop by here all the time. I liked having a good, heartfelt chat with him, over a mug of tea with a little something in it, talking about life. Yeah… Then he stopped showing up. I figured the Zone finally wore him down too. But the other day a stalker mentioned the guy's still alive. Maybe you can find him? Ask why he doesn't come by anymore. Maybe he took offense? Or maybe he needs help with something. Just don't drag it out… alright? The stalker who saw my friend is Vovan Dneva. He's working somewhere in the Swamps.
Suit yourself. Maybe you'll find something better.
Hello, stalker. How should I address you?
Just Marked One. I don't remember any other name.
Alright then, we'll know each other, Marked One. What brings you here — business, or just dropped by for a visit?
Depends on what you call business. The Barman is wondering — why don't you come to the bar anymore? He's worried he might have offended you somehow.

Why don't I come by? Well… how do I put it… Embarrassing to admit, but… I'm hiding. I owe Baldy — damn fool me, got talked into throwing dice with him. At first it was small stakes, seemed like luck was on my side. But once we started playing big… I went bust. Even borrowed to keep playing. Lost big. So the Bar's off-limits for me now. I've scraped together something already, but I can't pay off the whole debt yet.
I've heard about your debt. I've got a bit of loot.

And you're ready to help me just like that? I'm in deep — I owe two third-tier artifacts. I've got one, but where to get the second — no idea… And that bastard Baldy insists the artifacts have to be in good condition.

You sure had yourself a night, no doubt about it. If it weren't for my own interest in this matter… and the Barman asked me to help you. Alright, I'll try to sort out your problem. Wait here, don't go anywhere. I need to swing by my stash.
You sure had yourself a night, no doubt about it. If it weren't for my own interest in this matter… and the Barman asked me to help you. Alright, here's a suitable artifact.
Where would I go? I'll wait.
Well I'll be… Thanks. I'll be at the bar in a few days then. Tell the Barman so. Let him wait.
I will, I will…
Marked One, well hello. How are you?
Doing alright. You said you needed a third-tier artifact, right?
Yes, badly. In good condition.
Soon. Wait.
I've got one. Here, take it.
Hey, Marked One, what are you doing here? I'm heading to the bar soon, and you're still busy with your own business?
People say you're the one in charge of pouring around here?
What?! Want me to pour happiness into your ugly mug with an axe?
Sorry, bad choice of words. I need a couple of jars of your moonshine. The guys in the Swamps asked for it badly.
What, did Silvestr run out of booze? The boys feeling sad?
Stalkers say — and I've heard it myself — your stuff packs more punch than his technician's brew. So, can we make a deal?

Hmm… Maybe we can, if you do one thing for me. Been wanting a new cloak sewn from flesh hides for a while now. This one's completely worn out, filthy, won't clean anymore. There's an old man in the Swamps, goes by Stepanich — you probably know him. Order the cloak from him. Just a work outfit for me, nothing fancy. By the time you're back, the first run will be ready. And don't even think about trying to pass off some worn-out rag as new.
A new cloak?! I'll need to think about that…

Hmm… Maybe we can, if you do one thing for me. Been wanting a new cloak sewn from flesh hides for a while now, just never had the time. This one's completely worn out, filthy, won't clean anymore. There's an old man in the Swamps, goes by Stepanich. Order the cloak from him. Just a work outfit for me, nothing fancy. By the time you're back, the first run will be ready. And don't even think about trying to pass off some worn-out rag as new.
A new cloak from flesh hides?! And where am I supposed to get those hides?
Ask Ignat. He'll explain everything.
I'm here about your moonshine. The guys in the Swamps must be waiting already…
Ah, it's you, Marked One. Brought the cloak?
Brand new, just like we agreed.
Look at that workmanship — can't even see the seams, and the finishing…
Prosha, you can admire it later. The boys are burning up over there.
They won't die. Here, take the jars — pure distillate… crystal clear.
God, it stinks like hell…
I met your friend.
And? How is he — alive and well? Did he say when he'd come to the bar?
He's planning to come by in a few days. He owes Baldy. I helped your friend out a bit, like you asked. I think it'll work itself out.

Yeah, I figured. I knew I could count on you. Now to business — the PSZ-9Md armored spacesuit. The batch was made to order for a defense research institute. Dolgovyazyi checked it, all systems are operational. It's the best I can offer… And here, take something for the road.

Yeah, I figured. I knew I could count on you. Now to business — the PSZ-9Md armored spacesuit. The batch was made to order for a defense research institute. Take it to Dolgovyazyi, have him double-check all systems and patch it up if needed. It's the best I can offer… And here, take something for the road.
That's a serious suit.
Find one of the bandit "authorities" and clarify the rumors about the missing common stash
I need a suit with a closed-cycle breathing system.
And what do you need it for? Where are you planning to dive in it? Into a swamp or something?
Like you don't know?! I'm heading to the old laboratory in the Dark Valley. Folks say it was sealed up, and to be safe, they pumped gas into it to keep outsiders away.

Didn't happen without the military. Their dirty methods. No doubt they gassed the eggheads too, so nobody would blurt something out. \nI've got a suit — a real armored spacesuit. Once, at some research institute, they made a batch for... who exactly doesn't matter. And we'll settle this like so... I wouldn't trust anyone else with it, but I'll ask you.
Say what needs to be done — as long as I don't have to off anyone... you know.
I know your kind of jobs. First it's a run from one end of the Zone to the other, your ass on fire, and in the end nothing but losses from that kind of "exercise." I'll pass — I'll look elsewhere.

For a while now there's been a stubborn rumor that someone "swiped" the bandits' common stash in the Dark Valley. Whether it's true or not, and who was involved — everyone wants to find out. Me included. There must have been huge sums there, maybe even something else. It couldn't have just vanished.\nThere's a guy at Borov's base who feeds me bits of information from time to time.\nMaybe you could try to find him and loosen his tongue — see if he can confirm that rumor?
Suit yourself. Maybe you'll find something better.
The bandit "authority" asks you to bring a crate of hunting sausage and two jars of moonshine. After that, he's ready to clarify the rumors about the missing common stash
What're you snooping around here for, huh? Look at you darting your eyes around! Spy?
Yeah. I'm a spy. Watching so I can tell people how you've dumped piles of crap all over the place. Doesn't it disgust you yourselves? You've planted "mines" everywhere...

What are you, a sanitation worker? We dump where we want! Ain't nobody telling us what to do... Got it! If we want, we'll drag in a bunch of "professors" and they'll lick everything clean. We've got money coming out our ears... Had...
Oh yeah? I've heard something else. Rumor's going around that your Borov got played like a sucker. Someone made off with all his — and your — cash.
Rumor? Yeah, people yap. There's plenty of yapping in the Zone... Listen to everyone and you won't respect yourself. Though...
Go on, go on...

Hey, don't rush me! I ain't hitched yet! See — my throat's shot bad, and in general! You should've put some decent grub on the table. Me and the boys've been eating all kinds of crap instead of proper food for three days now. Word is, over in the Gut, those local hunters — damn them — make some damn fine sausage and distill top-notch booze, not that local rotgut. Wanna know what happened to our loot? Then bring a crate of their sausage and a couple jars of their moonshine. We'll drink, we'll eat, and we'll talk business.
What kind of crooks are you, if you can't even feed yourselves...
Alright, I've got a deal like that. Here.
Hey, don't get smart! We've got stuff you've never even seen! We just want something simple — like in the old days, by the campfire, with some food...

Oh! You're a real solid guy! Respect! So, about the loot...\nShort version — Borov's a big authority, not some chump... He knows stalkers are just itching to swipe our hard-earned common stash. Ever heard of Besyara the snitch? Always stretching his claws out — oughta put that bastard down! So here's how it is... We started singing left and right that the stash was gone, that stalkers stole it. But it never went anywhere! It's all hidden in a safe place. And nobody knows where! Only the Boss! And a couple of close authorities. And they don't dig into the stash unless they have to, so it doesn't get exposed. That's how it is!
Got it. Strange, though. Alright then, take care, "authorities".
Ah! The spy! Still snoopin' around?
I've got doubts. You said to bring some snacks? Five sausages?
Don't try to bluff me! What the hell do I need your stinky sausage for?! Bring a crate of hunting sausage! And two jars of their moonshine. Then we'll talk proper.
Oh, it's you again. What d'you want now?
Hey, Ignat. I need a crate of your sausage.
Liked it that much, or decided to start a business?
Some brothers in the Dark Valley are complaining about Borov's rations. Asked me to bring them... something tasty. And a couple jars of your drink — the boozy kind.
So they can drink and eat at the same time. That's right. And what are they offering?
They're not offering anything — it's kind of a trial run. What do you want? I mean payment.
For a batch of sausages... I'll charge you a receipt for a grand. And as for our moonshine, that's Prosha's business, he's the one... pouring it. Work it out with him.
For a batch of sausages... I'll take a couple of level three artifacts off you. And the moonshine's ours — that's Prosha's business, he's the one pourin' it out. Make the deal with him.
If I strike it rich, I'll come by.
I'm here for the crate of sausages, got it together?
And what do you owe?
Here's the receipt for a thousand bucks.
Here are two good artifacts.
I'll check, maybe it's not ready yet.
Take the crate. If the bros like the sausage, let them send runners. We'll work out the price.
I'll pass it along for sure...
Ignat says you're in charge of the pouring?
What the hell?! Want me to pour happiness all over your mug with an axe?
Sorry, bad choice of words. I need a couple jars of your moonshine. The guys in the Dark Valley were really asking.
What, did Borov run outta booze? The boys feeling sad?
The bros say, and I've heard myself, that your stuff hits harder than their bootleg. So, can we make a deal?

Hmm... maybe we can, if you do a job. Over in the Swamps, the scientists' quartermaster is peddling three-liter jars. Bring ten bottles, I'll fill two for you, the rest goes toward payment. We're short on containers. By the time you're back, the first run'll be ready.
You'll get your containers.
I'm about the moonshine for the Valley bros.
Ah, it's you, Marked One. You bring the containers?
Ten jars, like we agreed.
Just look at that glass. Pure crystal. Almost a shame to dirty it.
Prosha, you can admire it later. The guys' throats are burnin'.
Your boys won't die. Here, take the jars, pure distillate... a tear.
Damn, it reeks like hell...
I talked to your "authority," but...
What "but"? Speak straight — who took the common stash, where is it now, who's lookin'?

That bandit of yours is only good for eatin' and boozin'. Seemed to me he doesn't know squat. Says Borov hid the common stash real safe. And the rumor was spread as a smokescreen, 'cause stalkers started sniffin' around, especially Bes, he's been pushin' hard. Me personally, I don't quite buy it. But the fact they've got no decent food — that I can say for sure.
Doesn't buy it, huh. This ain't roulette... I told you to dig up everything down to the bone, and you just shot the breeze and learned nothin' solid. That's bad work!
Bad?! I did everything you said! Met who I had to, talked it through. You know how much it cost just to lay out a spread to get the talk goin'? Anyway — pay up already!
You're a noisy one, Marked One. I was just puttin' the fear in you... Here's the suit, Vergas checked everything, the systems run like clockwork. And be careful... in that lab.
You're a noisy one, Marked One. I was just puttin' the fear in you... Here's the suit, take it to Vergas so he can check everything, patch it up, just to be safe. And be careful... in that lab.
Serious suit...
I wanted to ask about storing monster parts.

Wasn't enough hassle already, now I gotta deal with this too. Ivan Sergeich gave the orders, so bring it in, we'll store it. One condition though — aside from a controller's hand, a chunk of a giant, a poltergeist's eye, and an electrochimera kidney, I won't take anything else. And only one part at a time. The fridge ain't rubber. To preserve one monster part you'll need... two jars of "Fruit Punch". Bring the jars right away, I know your kind. The rest my assistant explained to you already, as I understand.
Two?! Then give me the containers for the "Fruit Punch".

You'll manage without. This ain't glass for half-liter bottles. Imported stuff, pure silicate, costs big money. I won't give it away for free. Bring the monster meat or hand over artifacts, I'll trade. Got it?
Got it, got it... Pakhom, your rats ain't croaked yet?
What's that about rats all of a sudden? Well, they're scrawny, mangy.
Yeah, figures... with an owner like that.
I want to put monster parts into storage.
You bring the jars of "Fruit Punch"?
Of course, pure emerald.
Don't tell me you broke it...
What kind of rotten crap did you bring?
A controller's hand.
A giant's paw.
A poltergeist's eye.
An electrochimera kidney.
Just asking.
You haven't taken the old hand yet.
You haven't taken the old paw yet.
You haven't taken the old eye yet.
You haven't taken the old kidney yet.
Yeah?! Must be my memory acting up.
Alright then, what have you got there.
Alright then, what have you got there.
Alright then, what have you got there.
Alright then, what have you got there.
Here's a controller's hand and two full jars.
Here's a giant's paw and two full jars.
Here's a poltergeist's eye and two full jars.
Here's an electrochimera kidney and two full jars.
You can pick it up in a couple of days.
I remember.
I want to pick up my monster parts.
Which ones exactly?
A controller's hand.
A giant's paw.
