You tell me first — you bring the document?
A soldier's word's firmer than peas! Here's your paper... Trade!
Take the vodka.
Here's the paper.
\nThe Barkeep asked me to find out about one eccentric foreigner. Supposedly he was heading to the Red Forest through the Wild Territory
Why are you staring like that? Something else happen?

Everything's more or less the same. I've got a small request. There's been a curious fellow wandering the Zone. Supposedly a foreigner... though who really knows. A drunkard, a joker, a real oddball. If he showed up at the Bar, you could barely squeeze through here for a week straight. People would just pour in to listen to him. He was great at spinning tales. Where he claimed he'd been... obviously nonsense, but damn, he sold it with talent. An actor, plain and simple... And a nice profit for me. Stalkers eat and drink well while listening.
Half the people around here have talents like that.
Maybe, but not all of them. This one's special. And a foreigner, too.
Could be an alien for all I care. What do you want from me? I didn't sign up to be a clown. Entertain your own crowd.

No one's asking you to sing or dance. He needs to be found, the guy's gone missing. Last I heard, he was heading for the Red Forest. Duty boys at the checkpoint said he went through the Wild Territory. Carried away, the fool. If you're around there, have a look. Sure, monsters are nasty, anomalies and all that... It's not urgent, but still — a man was here, and now he's gone. Kind of a pity.
Any distinctive features? How do I recognize him? And what's his name?
Say your profits dropped, that's all. This whole "pity" thing...

He called himself Freeman. As for features... nothing special, really. Looked like an ordinary stalker. Oh, I remember! He had a fine pistol — a Desert Eagle. And he shot it damn well, even when drunk.
No need to be like that, Marked One. He was still a man...
Pour one, Barkeep. Let's drink to your storyteller.
You found him? Where, what happened?

In the Wild Territory, in an old tunnel. He set himself up a little den there. A bedroll in a container, a small campfire nearby, only... Looks like after the Blowout the tunnel exit got blocked by "Electras". He didn't get out. I figure he died of thirst or starvation.
Imagine that... better to fall into an anomaly or get torn apart by a bloodsucker. But like that... horrifying.
It happens. Better tell me this instead. How do you get from the Wild Territory to the Red Forest? He was heading there, right?
It happens. In the Zone, an easy death is a real rarity. Unless it's from a bullet...

You don't know? There's a passage, I'll mark it on your PDA. This road will take you to the eastern part of the forest, roughly around here. And thanks for not brushing my request off, you did the right thing.
Ah... Thanks for not brushing my request off, you did the right thing. And this is for you, as a token of gratitude.
Yeah, it's nothing... Just somehow it's not very cheerful again...
You mentioned a parcel — who was it from?
A man came by. Described your mug. Can't mistake yours for anyone else. Paid some cash and said to hand it over personally.
Didn't say who he was?

I didn't ask. My job's simple — took the payment, passed on the parcel. Looks like your antics are doing the sender some good. Or maybe he's the one who ordered that Strelok? Anyway, take your loot and... enjoy.
Yeah... Thanks, I guess, but this is strange...
You mentioned a parcel — who was it from?
A man came by. Described your appearance. Yours can't be confused with anyone else. Paid some money and said to hand it over personally.
Do you know him? Who is he?
Looked like an ordinary stalker. I didn't ask his name. And why would I? My job's simple — hand over the parcel, especially since the service was well paid. So take it and... enjoy.
Yeah... Thanks, I guess, but this is strange...
You mentioned a parcel — who was it from?
Well I'll be, you showed up. How should I know who he was. The guy described your mug, I knew right away it was about you. I don't care about his name. What matters is he shelled out the cash.
All of this feels kind of strange...
And what don't you like about it? Maybe he's your secret sponsor. So grab your treasure and be happy.
Yeah... Thanks, of course, but still...
Man, that sanatorium burer was a real beast.
You actually ran into it? How was it?
A terrifying creature, I'll tell you. To take one like that down you'd need a howitzer. Burned through a ton of ammo before I put it down.

Didn't you know that among identical monsters there are especially seasoned ones. Against those, you shouldn't even think of going in with a regular gun. The only good thing is they're extremely rare around here. They mostly live closer to the center of the Zone.
Then I guess I got lucky.

By the way, did it have an artifact on it? I told you about the "Bubble". I'm thinking of heading to the Bar one of these days, sick of this place already. On the way, you know it yourself, there are dogs everywhere. An artifact like that would really come in handy.
And what in return? I'll warn you right away — junk won't cut it. For an artifact like that I can gear up at Sidorovich's.

Yeah, just make sure you don't end up owing me. So... this... I can offer a pump-action shotgun, shortened — an "MP-133". Very compact and handy, five-round capacity. I'll also throw in some buckshot for it. For the local wildlife it'll be just right. And with buckshot you can go after more seasoned beasts too, not just dogs and tushkanos. Decide!
Hmm... deal.
You're trying to swindle me, Shustry. No deal.
Excellent! I guarantee you won't regret it, Marked One.
Your call, I don't make the offer twice.
You had some local nutcase hanging around here. Is he still around?
What do you need him for?
Thought maybe he'd still say something useful about the fragment.
They took him away.
Took him away? Where to?
For treatment, I guess. Ivan Sergeich said it was to Yantar. The head professor there will examine him.
Hmm... That's strange...
It's quiet around your Swamps, no one's yelling.
Yeah, sure, less noise now, almost boring.
Did your crazy guy really go beyond the Barrier?
The scientists took him.
Took him? Where to?
For treatment, probably. Lukash said it was to Yantar. The professors there will examine him. What it's really like doesn't concern me.
Interesting... I should go take a look.
What's that body you've got lying there? I think I know him.
Oh? And who is he? He didn't introduce himself to us.
Looks like that madman from the Army Warehouses. Is he sleeping?
You could put it that way. He started acting a bit violently, so we had to administer a sedative.
So why do you need him? Can you really help him?
Are you saying that you can? We will at least try...
Still. Are you planning to run experiments on him? I was told correctly that all scientists here are...

Don't talk nonsense, Marked One! Why did he interest you so much in the first place? A relative, someone close, an acquaintance? Step outside into the yard and you'll see others like him, but in a much worse condition. Do they interest you to the same extent as this one? Or would you prefer the tried-and-true method of "treatment" — an AK?
Uh... well...
Exactly, better keep quiet. You shouldn't speak rashly or slap labels on things without understanding them. It's better you attend to your own business, and let us attend to ours.
I'm here on an assignment from one of the Duty bosses.
From Voronin or what? They've got a habit of turning their noses up at regular folk over there. Like — "We're DUTY, and you're nobody"... Well, screw that... What do you want?
Yeah, they're like that... Not from Voronin. He's got a deputy in charge of food. Says he wants to make a deal with you about supplies...

Ah, that one. What's his name... Anyway, I get who you mean. Well... in principle, we're not against it. Those Duty guys are hunters too, seems like, also cleaning up the Zone. In their own way, sure. If they offer something worthwhile, we're in. I reckon we could feed fifty mouths, maybe even more...
He's asking for samples. For testing, sort of...

Oh yeah! Let's be straight, friend Marked One. You're a solid guy and all that, sure, but put yourself in my shoes — someone shows up, says he's from someone, and asks for our goods... Words alone don't fill a stomach, right?\nI can put together a box of samples for you, no problem, but you know how it is — quid pro quo. I sometimes travel a bit farther than the Bar on my own business. And in those parts the air's a bit poisoned. You get a cloak made for me from Stepanych, there's a craftsman like that. Just a regular one, but with a gas mask built in. Stepanych usually hangs around either in the Swamps or at the Forgotten Farmstead. I'll give you the material for the cloak — a couple of cured flesh hides — and as for the work itself, you'll settle that on the spot. Deal?
Hand over the hides, you'll get your cloak.
The Duty boys can manage without sausage.
Take the hides, I'll be waiting for the new gear.
They won't die, that's for sure. Heh-heh.
Ignat asks that, in exchange for a batch of sausage for Duty, you order a brown cloak with a gas mask from Stepanych
Our deal about the Duty samples still on?
Everything's been ready for a while. What took you so long?
The old geezer jacked the price up, and the tailoring took time. Take the new gear.

Hmm, solid outfit. I packed our delicacies into a box here. Pass it on to whoever needs it. Tell them we can ship about this much every couple of days, if they supply us with certain things. And this one's personally for you — eat up and enjoy.
I'm off, beat already...
Bored again, feeling blue?
Thinking... but so far nothing useful has come to mind.
Care to share, or is it a secret?

With you I can share, you're a proper man. You see, Marked One, I've put together a small arsenal, more or less. But ammo's a problem. I went to the military guys over at the pumping station, but they jacked the price up sky-high, and in hard currency to boot.
That's like them, sure enough — "one man's war is another man's business".
Exactly.... How are things between you and Duty? I'm interested in their logistics deputy — Petrenko.
So far, fine. You could even say excellent.

Then I've got a favor to ask. Check with him, but don't push too hard, whether they could set up ammo supplies for us. I'm interested in 5.45x39 and 7.62x39 calibers. We've got plenty of pistol rounds and shotgun shells.
And how are you planning to pay? I'm not asking for myself.

The Swamps may be the edge of the Zone, but some artifacts do turn up here. Sometimes even second-tier ones. A tin or two doesn't interest me. I need at least a crate of ammo every month. If he agrees, we'll discuss the exact price personally. Either way, you'll get something for your trouble. A good recipe, for instance. Will you go and ask?
What you need that much ammo for is your business. I can ask, no skin off my nose.
Planning a little local war, are you? Count me out.
Sylvester asked me to check with Petrenko about the possibility of supplying ammunition
Pour it up, Sylvester! I've got good news for you.
Could you keep it down? I'll pour later. What did Petrenko say?
He's not exactly against it, but there won't be a meeting with him. A Duty unit is currently stationed in the Swamps. Major Cherepanov is in charge. You'll have to settle everything with him.
So he didn't want to talk to me personally?

Busy man. Second in their hierarchy, practically the whole of Duty rests on him. A crate of ammo is peanuts to him. One wagon here, one wagon there — that's more his scale. And... where's what was supposed to fall my way?
Sorry, I got my head all muddled. Here... write down the recipe. Picked it up from the prof's assistant the other day...
I'm here on an assignment, from the Swamps.
And who would need me there?

There's a certain character there at the scientists' base... He's their cook and a small-time trader, stands behind the counter... Long story short, his name's Sylvester, and he's very interested in the possibility of trading artifacts for ammo in 5.45x39 or 7.62x39. And straight up a full crate. He won't agree to less.
So what's happened in the Swamps that he suddenly needs that much ammunition? It's supposed to be a quiet place. What's there to fight over?
Personally, I don't care who's fighting whom over what. Maybe he just wants a stockpile. In case... someone attacks.

Could be... I've heard about their scientists from Sakharov. Studying all kinds of mutant trash, don't poke their noses beyond the Swamps... Strange... So he's offering artifacts? Well then, I'll need to think about it. And also check on your Sylvester through my own channels, see what kind of man he is, what makes him tick.
How long will I have to wait? Maybe I should come back later?

Hold on, don't rush... I've got a delicate matter for you. About a month ago, one of our fighters, a good one, suddenly left the unit and disappeared in an unknown direction. We're not the army, of course, but we don't encourage desertion! I'd like to find out what happened.

Hold on, don't rush... I've got a delicate matter for you. About a month ago, one of our fighters, a good one, suddenly left the unit and headed toward the Army Warehouses. As I later learned, he died there soon after. I don't know what pushed him to desert, and it doesn't matter anymore. What matters is that he left with all his gear, and it's still listed on our books.
You want me to convince him to come back... or something else? And where am I supposed to look for him, scour the whole Zone?
So what, you can't just write it off as combat losses?

Don't worry, others dug before you. He's at the Army Warehouses now, goes by the nickname Scarecrow. Go see him, talk to him. And try to get an answer to the question — should we expect this "prodigal son" back or not. If not, then the equipment he received from us ought to be returned. Why I'm not sending my own people, I think, is obvious. Hostile territory and all that. And would he even be frank with former comrades... You, on the other hand, are neutral. Maybe he won't clam up with you.

Can't sign it off while there's still a chance to return everything to the warehouse. The thing is, a friend of the deceased, who brought us the sad news, also shared information about where the dead man stashed our property when he bailed to civilian life. There's a little village in the Warehouses stalkers call "Krovososovka". That's where it all is, in the stove of one of the ruined houses. As you understand, I can't send my people to retrieve the gear on territory controlled by Freedom. That's why I'm asking you to handle it.
Talking to him is doable... I'll try.
Sounds simple enough. I'll try.
Petrenko asked me to find out why their former fighter nicknamed Scarecrow suddenly left the ranks of Duty. I should look for him at the Army Warehouses.

Petrenko asked me to find and return property belonging to his faction that was taken some time ago to the Army Warehouses by a deserter. It should be hidden in the stove of one of the houses in the village of "Krovososovka".
Greetings, commander. I met with your runaway.
And what did he say? How did he explain his... disappearance?

Long story short, he's tired of the Zone. Lost a friend not long ago. He's not coming back. Decided to wax his skis. Says he's going home. Asked me to return his gear so he wouldn't be considered a thief.
That's a shame. He was a good fighter. Not like some others. And you, I see, didn't disappoint either — could've pocketed it. I respect that.
Expenses ought to be compensated, don't you think?

Compensated... fine. Tell that Sylvester that a platoon under Major Cherepanov is currently quartered in the Swamps. Let him settle all matters with him. I've already warned him. I don't have time to be distracted by such trifles.
Greetings, commander. I was at the Army Warehouses. Found your gear the deserter took with him.
Very good. Let's see what you've got.
Here — your suit, and an "Abakan" as well.

And where's the PKM? Decided to pocket it? Relax, I'm joking. The main thing is you brought the important stuff back; expendables were written off long ago. Thanks on behalf of the service, so to speak.
Thanks, he says... Expenses ought to be compensated, don't you think?

Compensated... fine. Tell that Sylvester that a platoon under Major Cherepanov is currently quartered in the Swamps. Let him settle all matters with him. I've already warned him. I don't have time to be distracted by such nonsense.
Hi there, friend. How's life?
Friend?! And who are you supposed to be?
Name's Marked One. Haven't heard of me?
Marked One? Heard something. They say you crawled into the underground at Agroprom and came out alive? Crazy... I'm Scarecrow, that's my nickname.
So it was about you they were whispering in the Bar, that you left Duty? Why? Didn't like the gear, or the food?

Gear, food? What's that got to do with it... My buddy got shot somewhere around here. When I found out, I grabbed my legs and ran here. Thought I'd make it in time to help. Didn't. He died. I sat, thought it over — what do we even need in this life? We hustle, follow all kinds of rules. I'm sick of it!
Yeah... So you're not planning to go back?

No. I thought it over in my spare time — I spent half a year slogging it out in that "Duty", and what do I have to my name? Three holes and nothing else. I'll try the stalker life. I know the Zone pretty well by now. I think I can save up a bit for a rainy day. And then I'm gone. Home.\nYeah, by the way. To feel completely "clean", I should return the gear I got while in service. You heading to the Bar?
Sure, I'll take it. I'm headed that way anyway. I'll give it to Petrenko.
I stuffed it into a backpack in Krovososovka, it's in the stove of a ruined house. Keep it if you want, or give it back. There's body armor and an "Abakan" there.
Didn't expect to see you here. Weren't you heading out on a raid?
Command ordered a change of position. For now we're sitting here, waiting for orders.
Ah... Wanted to ask something, if it's not a secret.
Depends on what you're interested in. Might answer.
So where were you planning to ski off to on that raid? Maybe I could tag along. I'm sick of all this running around. Time to get down to some serious business.

Hmm... You're a solid guy, Marked One, but we in "Duty" have our own rules and routines. We may not be the military, but we follow established rules strictly. You can't just go by "feel like it, don't feel like it". Regulations...
I've seen plenty of your regulation-style relations in the Bar. Some are on duty, while others rinse their throats from morning till night. Where does it all even fit.
That happens. In any family, as they say... I don't justify them, but everyone can have their own good reasons... I think you understand.
I do... only it turns out you're just like ordinary stalkers, except you've learned to shout "Fall in!" and "Attention!"
If that's all, then be on your way. I won't keep you.
Dan, how long are you going to take stinking tails as payment for passage?
What did you expect? Stinking or not, the Zone's getting cleaner.

Maybe so, but that's not what I mean... How about I bring you something worthwhile once, and then I can walk through calmly, without looking over my shoulder. There are plenty of people to cleanse the world of all sorts of filth. Around here it's step left, step right — if it's not a tushkano, it's a dog, or something even meaner. If I brought in all the monster parts I shoot just to trade for buckshot, you'd have to hand me a whole wagon of that ammo.
You've certainly proven your usefulness. And we treat you with all due respect. But breaking the rules...

Oh come on, Dan. What rules, who approved them? Tell the village guys about lofty ideals. You're not throwing that monster meat in the trash anyway. You're running your own little business too, right? Food, water, clothes, weapons — none of that falls from the sky. You get it somewhere, for something.

You haven't been drinking today, have you? Doesn't seem like it smells... Alright, we'll make a deal if you bring me either three cured flesh hides or five raw ones. I'll order myself a cloak from Stepanych. I think you know where to get them.\nI might even be willing then to set aside more buckshot specifically for you to trade.
I know. Not my first day...

Dan asks that, in exchange for permanent free passage to Kishka, there and back, I bring him either three cured flesh hides or five raw ones. He also promises to set aside more buckshot for me to trade.
Our deal still on?
If you're talking about the hides, then yes.
Take the three cured ones.
Brought five raw ones.
Just wanted to check if you'd changed your mind.

Well then. From now on, the passage is always open for you. Just don't go rushing headlong — stop by, exchange a few words now and then, otherwise other stalkers might see and not understand. They might think we've got favoritism going on here. And come by for buckshot to trade, I'll set aside a few packs for you over the daily norm.
Why the sour mug? Down in the dumps again?

No, not really. Mental work's got my body all tense, not used to it.\nSome kind soul brought me a pile of technical manuals on weapons. I'm trying to figure out how to do various upgrades and tuning in these local, makeshift conditions. So far it's going rough.\nWithout a bottle, all my brain folds got tangled up. You don't happen to have one on you?
Soon there won't be anything left to tangle, you'll drink it all away, brains included.

You're wrong, Marked One. I've more or less grasped the principle, the noggin's still working. I just need narrowly specialized tools, for fine tuning and calibration. Where are you supposed to find those in the Zone? I tried working with what I had, but only messed everything up.\nMaybe you could swing by Sidorovich, and grab some vodka while you're at it?
Have you lost your mind, pal?!

You got me wrong. I ordered the tools from Sidorovich. He opened a line of credit for me a long time ago, and I help him out from time to time... with various things. I figure my limit isn't used up yet, so I'm just asking you to work a bit as a courier. Well, if it turns out to be short by a bit, you can top it up from your own, alright?\nAnd once I've got the tools, I'll upgrade some gun for you free of charge. For example, right now I'm getting my hand in on pump-actions. Our guys just got a batch of new shotguns, and I'm planning to convert them to semi-auto fire. It'll be a killer piece, high rate of fire. And considering the magazine capacity — any critter's done for. Cool, right? So, will you help?
If I'm at Sidorovich's, I'll ask about your tools.
Getting his hand in, huh... Find someone younger to run to the Cordon.
That's great then. And grab some vodka too, yeah?
Pity... Oh well, I'll keep poking around like this for now. Maybe someone more agreeable will turn up later.

Shurup offered me courier work: I need to bring him a crate of new tools from Sidorovich. Supposedly payment between them is already arranged, but as a last resort he asks me to pay out of my own pocket. In return he promises to upgrade some gun for me.
I brought you the crate with the tools.
I was starting to worry something happened to you... Did you bring any vodka?

You bastard, why didn't you warn me your credit with Sidor's been maxed out for ages? By the way, I had to hand over a valuable artifact for that crate. Take it. You owe me big time now, keep that in mind. And to hell with you, no vodka for you, got it?

Alright, alright, why're you yelling like that? Well, yeah... now that I think about it, my credit really did go "poof"... back last summer. Don't be mad, but I really need these tools. Big thanks for bringing them anyway. Here, take a few repair kits, might come in handy.\nLet's check the shipment... So much stuff here... There's even a caliper. Now that's what I call it!
You can admire it later. Better tell me, what about the shotguns? Your Lukash issued me a "USAS-12". Can it be upgraded or what?
Bring it over. I'll do it right. You won't regret it.
I'll believe you this time.
I'm here about the tools for Shurup. He said everything's settled between you.
Settled, yes. I just thought he'd come for them himself. Sent you instead, did he? And what's that master-fixer planning to repair that he had to order a whole set of tools straight from the capital?
Marked One, I already told you: the order's here. Pay and take it. A "dummy" class artifact in good condition. Verstehen, nicht?
As I understand it, he's taken up improving weapon characteristics. So, the order's arrived — can I take it?
Ah, damn, right! The artifact... There'll be an artifact, but later.
Look, will this one do for you?

Yeah, it's lying over there in the corner, waiting. You didn't forget the payment, I hope? I warned Shurup right away I'd ask at least a good-condition "dummy" class artifact. He's lucky I didn't have to import the goods from abroad. That would've cost him twice as much.
That'll do nicely. I don't get ones like this often. You wouldn't tell me where you dug it up, would you? Ah well. Take your crate.

What do you mean? And what about the credit? I was told the payment would go against the credit opened for Shurup. Supposedly the limit wasn't used up yet, and if it was a bit short I could add some. You don't mean to say it's short by the equivalent of a whole "dummy", do you?
I'll go "congratulate" Shurup on his new acquisition and say a few kind words.

Snap out of it, you poor soul. It's been almost a year since I stopped giving that drunk anything on credit. At first he paid back at least somehow, then he did small errands for me when I had liquidity problems, but how much debt can you write off like that? The ordered tools are really damn expensive, you heard it yourself. So there are no options here: pay, or I'll have to look for another buyer.
Well damn... Quite a situation. I need to think.
You taking on upgrading the "USAS"?
If you brought it, hand it over. I reworked a couple for our guys here for field tests. They can't praise them enough.
And how long will it take? And in general...
I'll do it in half a day. Experience, you could say, is already there. I won't charge you, like I promised. Just show some respect with a bottle, that'll be enough.
Feels kind of sketchy handing something like this over to you. Ah, whatever, here.
Seems to me if you take it apart, no one will be able to put it back together. Better later.
I'll let you know when it's ready.
If it seems that way — cross yourself, and when you decide, come by.
How's my "USAS" doing?
Marked One, don't hover over me, you're getting in the way.
Better than before. The barrel's a sight to behold. Shiny as a cat's private parts.
Work, work...
I'm not here to admire it. Done yet?
You insult me — did everything as agreed. Not a shotgun anymore, a thunder-cannon. Mind you, pretty damn hungry. Use it.
Your bottle... Master Shurup.
I'll go too, test it out in the field.
Thanks, for the repair kits.
You could've poured me a drink, for the work.
Shurup's Rifle Upgrade
Hey there, "thinker"! What's got you wracking your brain? Don't tell me it's about where to get another drink? The fumes from you hit from ten steps away...

That's just me wiping down some mechanisms with alcohol. What I'm racking my brain over is how to get my hands on a certain little thing.\nSee, a close buddy of mine ordered himself an "FN FAL" rifle from beyond the perimeter, and it arrived yesterday. Powerful and reliable piece, but here's the snag — turned out the model that came has no mounts for attachments, and the magazine's small, only 20 rounds, and in general... it turned out to be a really awkward weapon. Returns, obviously, aren't an option. Sure, they smacked the middleman trader around for not warning them in advance, but what good did that do? My buddy burned a lot of money, and the rifle can't really be used properly.
There's a saying about situations like that, but I'll keep quiet. So what's this little thing you're trying to get? Some kind of "consolation prize" for your friend?

You're almost spot on. I saw in one weapons magazine that there are special upgrade kits like that, with all the necessary parts and gadgets to turn basic models into mega-advanced ones. Like special forces would take a break. So I want to get such a kit for the FAL.
So what's the problem then? Afraid you'll run into a shady trader yourself? I could recommend someone, if you need.

No need, I know who to talk to. The thing is, I've spent a lot lately after that last tool purchase, and I don't want to ask our guys for help — they'll laugh us to death over this whole story. Will you help me out, Marked One? I don't really have much to repay you with, but if you ever need to upgrade a FAL yourself, I'll be ready to do it for a purely symbolic fee — those kits come with everything in duplicate.
Well, what can you do with you "poor souls"... Alright, I'll try to help. An identical upgrade might come in handy for me too. For a "purely symbolic" fee...
So basically, your buddy got fleeced, and now you're offering me to pay for his expenses? Find yourself a fool!

There we go, thanks, Marked One! I already checked around through some contacts: the required FAL upgrade kit should be with Voron. You know that slick guy from the Dark Valley? The goods were delivered on special order for some stalker, but for reasons unknown to me the deal fell through, so Voron will be only too happy to find a new buyer.
I didn't really expect you to understand anyway...

Freedom mechanic Shurup is asking for help upgrading an "FAL" rifle for his friend. To do that he needs a special weapon upgrade kit that should be in Voron's possession. In return, he promises to help me with a similar upgrade if needed.
Dance for joy, Shurup Samorezovich! I hauled in your weapon upgrade kit.
Whoa! Now that's news! Show me already.
Here, and don't drop it — the case is pretty bulky.
Let's see what we've got here. Alright, rails... fittings... stocks here... Awesome! I'll do everything top-notch, my buddy won't even realize it's the same rifle. Huge thanks, Marked One!
Happy for your buddy. You owe me now, don't forget.

No question about it. If you ever need it, come by with your own FAL, I'll do some slick tuning for it too. Just keep in mind the rifle has to be in good shape — with a beat-up one, I'm afraid it won't work.
Alright. See you.
Shurup, I talked to Voron about your issue. You know what price he named for the upgrade kit?
I don't know, but I can guess. What, can't afford it?
I'll be straight: it's not worth it. Sorry, but you'll have to look for another seller or drop the whole idea. Either way — without me, I've already run enough, that's it.
Thanks for at least trying, Marked One. I'll think about what to do next.
Hey, Shurup, I want to upgrade my "FN FAL" rifle. Remember our deal?
I don't seem to be complaining about memory loss yet. Take it out, let's see.
Here. Looks like a regular base model, right? Can you work your magic on this one like you promised?
Uh... looks like I'm the one with memory problems after all. Left it somewhere... I'll be back soon.
No problem. I told you, it'll be like special forces gear. As agreed, the payment for the job is a "purely symbolic" one — a crate of the white stuff.

Have you completely lost it, pal? First I bought you a tool kit from Sidor, then I handed you a weapon upgrade kit for free, lent a helping hand in a tough moment, you could say, and now you're demanding a whole crate of vodka from me for a trivial service. Got any conscience?

Oh come on, Marked One. By the way, last time I didn't take anything for working on your "USAS". And now I'm in need — I told you, I've got to wipe down parts and all that... Well, at least half a crate, huh? Why are you staring like that? Alright, alright, you'll spot me one bottle — and we're even.

Oh come on, Marked One. Maybe next time I won't take anything from you at all. And now I'm in need — I told you, I've got to wipe down parts and all that... Well, at least half a crate, huh? Why are you staring like that? Alright, alright, you'll spot me one bottle — and we're even.
That's more like it! By the way, what parts were we talking about wiping down? Parts of your own body? Alright, forget it. Get to work already. How long will it take?
I think I'll manage in about six hours. The technology's already been worked out. I'll give you a signal when everything's ready.
Alright. I'll go get some vodka in the meantime.
Shurup, I got your message and came to pick up my rifle.
Yeah, I've been waiting for you. Brought the bottle? The piece turned out — pure fire. Should've bargained for cognac.
Say, you didn't happen to sell Herbalife in the past, did you? Take what's offered and show me what you did.
Damn it... I forgot about the vodka. Wait here, I'll be back soon.

Here, take it. Mounted rails for optics, replaced the fittings, installed a new stock, cleaned it, lubricated it. On top of that, there's a set of extended-capacity magazines. With a rifle like this you can march straight into Pripyat.
It really does look top notch. I'd better get going, I can see you're already itching to "wipe" something down with vodka...
Hi, Voron, I'm here on business. Freedom mechanic Shurup asked me to drop by and get a weapon upgrade kit for an "FN FAL" rifle. You do have one, right?
Oh, another one! That kit lay around useless for ages after the original buyer disappeared, and now two new contenders show up in a single day.
Are you saying I'm too late? The goods already gone?
Lucky for you — no. We couldn't agree on the price right away, your competitor decided to take time to "think it over".
So how much did you ask? Or...

Exactly — "or". You know I'm primarily interested in unusual and rare items. At the moment I have an order for a mercenary exoskeleton. That thing is fairly rare even among the mercs themselves. I'm not on the best terms with that rabble, and few dare to deal with them. Still, I know there's a merc post at the Army Warehouses, and there's a guy hanging around there nicknamed Vakhtang. He's quite loyal toward stalkers and even trades with them. I'm sure getting an exo through Vakhtang won't be too difficult.
Oh hell... An exoskeleton in exchange for some weapon kit! Are you out of your mind?
And not just any exoskeleton — a new one, absolutely new. No used cast-offs will do. That's my offer, period. Well, I might also throw in some ammo out of charity. Deal?
My kindness will be the death of me someday. On the other hand, I can always squeeze Shurup for his debt if needed. Bottom line — you'll get your exoskeleton, Voron.
I don't like it when someone twists my arms first and then offers a handshake.
Your squabbles don't concern me. You'll sort out who owes whom yourselves. You and I have our own deal — so get to fulfilling it.
That's life. No deal, then no deal.
Voron offered to exchange the weapon upgrade kit he has for an "FN FAL" rifle for a brand-new mercenary exoskeleton. One like that can be obtained from Vakhtang, a merc at the Army Warehouses.
I got you the merc exoskeleton, Voron. Everything as agreed.
Excellent! Hand it over, I need to check its condition.
I'm telling you, it's brand new — everything as agreed. But go on, check it, I don't mind.
Yep, everything's in perfect order. Here's your weapon kit and the promised ammo bonus. A pleasure doing business with you, Marked One.
You all say that, but once you ask for something... Ah, forget it. See you around.
Find the stalker known by the nickname Ghoul and learn from him about the fate of his partner
You look darker than a storm cloud today.

That's it, this guy's got me fed up! U-u-ugh, bastard! He sucks the life out of people. Whoever goes on a raid with him — all die! He's the only one who comes back alive and well! Fifth case already! In short, something unclean is going on here. And about his last partner, Valerka Shkelet, they say his fate was downright terrifying.\nI was the one who invited Valerka into the Zone. And now what am I supposed to tell his father and mother? They don't even have anything to bury.\nWe need to find this bastard and sort things out our own way...

Careful there, you're getting worked up. I don't deal in bloody business, but I agree — something here is definitely not right. I could try to clear things up, if you want. Tell me his name and at least roughly where to look for him.
Ghoul's his nickname. A ghoul, plain and simple. He steals people's luck — get it? He was seen in the Dark Valley recently. Might still be there. Just be careful with him, who knows.
Sounds like the devil himself, horns and all. I'll go have a talk with him.
Mind if I sit?
What? If you want something, say it. Otherwise, get lost!
No need to be rude right away. I don't think I've done anything to you. By the way, my name's Marked One. And yours?
Marked One, you say? Heard of you... Is that you they hauled with corpses in a truck? My name's Renat. That's enough.
Then nice to meet you, Renat. As for the truck — who knows, I don't remember. I came to in Sidorovich's basement, and before that — nothing in my head, empty.
Yeah? Lucky you. I mean it. I'd gladly smash my head against a rock myself, just to wipe away everything that's piled up in there. Lost so many partners... Some kind of curse.
What happened? Why did it turn out that way?

Why? E-e-eh... Carelessness, overconfidence, refusal to think things through, greed — can't do without that. Everything's mixed in.
My first partner jumped at a rat! Either it bit him or something. He jerked, stumbled, and slammed full tilt into a "Trampoline". He was a good guy. Cheerful.
The second got driven onto a rock by blind dogs, they knocked the rifle out of his hands. And he didn't have a backup weapon... Said he didn't want to carry extra weight...
The third... The third was Slava the Runner. We did, what... three runs together, yeah. Made decent profit. Then he spotted an artifact in a little swamp. The Geiger's crackling like crazy, the artifact's bouncing around down there, and Slava keeps trying to grab it. He did grab it. Only an hour later he couldn't move anymore. Radiation burned out all his insides. And we didn't have any anti-rads. Thought we could just drink vodka if anything... I dragged him back to base, but the next day he passed away.
Yeah... That's something.

Diman, my fourth partner, basically died by accident. A tushkano flew into an anomaly, it collapsed and spat out the remains... Well, a bone went straight into Diman's eye. Can you imagine? Incredible, but... an accident.
No one's safe from that. And the fifth?

Shkelet? Yeah, he met a terrible death...
We were returning from a long raid through the Foggy Thicket, a deadly place. Picked up some decent loot. We were heading toward the Dark Valley, past a lake. There's one there, full of "Jelly". I went first, he followed. It was quiet. Suddenly — a crack, a scream... Valerchik fell through. Right into the "Jelly", dead center. He stepped onto the planks. What possessed him?! While I was trying to figure out what to do, he was already dissolved up to the waist, and then gone completely... His scream still rings in my ears.
Later I went down there, scooped some of that sludge into a jar, and saw a gold crown floating on top. That's all that was left of the man...
I've sworn off it now! No more partners. I'd rather die myself than go through that again.
I see. Do you want to give the jar with his remains to his parents? At least they'll have a grave. I can take it to the Barman — he has contacts with relatives.

Yeah? That's good. Then take it.\nBy the way, Valerchik's backpack with the capsule in a container is still in that lake. I didn't go in... I mean, the backpack was obviously dissolved by the anomaly, but the container should've survived. If you're in the thicket and need a good artifact, look for it. Let me mark the approximate spot on your map.
Alright, I'll remember. Take care, Ghoul... And don't envy me.
So, Ghoul confessed, basically. Looks like he's not guilty.
Did you find out what happened to his partners?

Some died from their own foolishness, another lost his head to greed. And for someone else, fate dealt a bad hand. The Zone's like that. And your acquaintance ended up in "Jelly", in the Foggy Thicket. The plank under him cracked, probably rotted through.
Yeah... And how am I supposed to look Valerka's parents in the eye now. Didn't manage to keep the kid safe.
Ghoul gave me a jar with the substance that dissolved your acquaintance. You can see his gold crown in it. Give it to the parents, let them bury it.
I'll definitely pass it on. At least they'll have something to remember their son by. Ah... remember the lad.
Well then, I'll be going. It's not very cheerful around here.
Baldy asks to talk to a stalker known by the nickname "Brainiac" and find out why he is so lucky at gambling. He was last seen at the Army Warehouses
Word is someone really took you to the cleaners. True... or just rumors?

Cleaned me out like a sucker. There was this schemer hanging around here. Took me for everything I had. Whatever he throws — he wins, again and again. I've got a suspicion about that. Needs checking.\nYou're not too well-known yet, maybe you could get him talking about that incredible "luck"? And I won't skimp on the reward. I'll thank you like a king! Just hurry, if you want a nice cut. He might up and vanish, and then good luck finding him.
First tell me where to go and who to look for. Then I'll think about it.
It's not far. He hangs around the Army Warehouses. They call him Brainiac. Maybe you've heard?
Maybe I have. Though I get the feeling he won't say much. Still... they don't charge for asking, right?
You're Brainiac, right? Didn't get you mixed up?
That's me. And who might you be?
I've got just one name — Marked One.
We're all marked, one way or another. Got business, or is this just hello and goodbye?
I got curious about a rumor about you. They say at the Bar that luck treats you real wild? Like you left Baldy without his pants and all that?

Left Baldy without pants, sure! He's probably got so much loot piled up that if he ever decides to leave the Zone, he'll need to order a truck. And that's just to haul the artifacts out. But he won't leave. Plenty of suckers around. Every day's a profit. Now that's luck. And me — I placed a couple of bets, true, big ones, and luck smiled on me. And people are already happy to spin tales.\nGot lucky by chance... Or maybe not by chance. Ever heard of the artifact "Luck"? Lots of stories going around, but nobody's seen it with their own eyes. And if they have, would they tell?
The "Luck" artifact?! Haven't heard of that one.

Well, supposedly there's an artifact that brings luck — like you randomly hit a tushkano in the eye from half a kilometer with a shotgun, find good artifacts, always get invited on easy, well-paid jobs... And you're always lucky in cards or other games. That's the idea.\nAnd not long ago I found an artifact, hell knows what kind, nobody had seen anything like it before. I wanted to sell it at Yantar, but then my luck went crazy at the Bar! And after that, as soon as I stepped outside — picked up a couple more artifacts and a capsule! Maybe it's not because of it... but what if it is?
Yeah, sounds like a good thing... Maybe you'd sell it? Things haven't been going my way lately. What if your artifact really is that very "Luck"?
Selling it is possible... But you have to understand, I can't give any guarantees. Maybe I just got lucky that day. That happens, right?
Name your price.
Then, to cut to the chase... bring me a check for a thousand bucks and the artifact is yours. Deal?
That's not a small sum. I'll think about it.
Just think fast. If you came here, others will too. And someone will turn out more agreeable.
Haven't sold "Luck" yet, or already?
A couple of people came by, but they're also... thinking. So, decided to buy it?
Yeah, here's the check.
Still looking.
Well then, it's yours. Just, as they say... don't mess it up yourself.
I'm not a believer.
I talked to Brainiac, sort of heart to heart.

Heart to heart my ass! He's a con artist! I dug up something on that character. Sent a runner after you to warn you, but looks like you missed each other.\nHe plays rarely, but always big. If he scores a good haul, his accomplices spread rumors among stalkers about some exotic artifact that supposedly brings luck. You're lucky at dice, always get Blackjack in cards, artifacts fall into your backpack from the sky, and all that nonsense. The suckers bite, and he sells them all kinds of crap as a "curiosity" for good money. By the time people figure it out, he's long gone.\nI can tell by your face: you bought something from him. Right?
Yeah, an artifact, called "Luck"...
Well aren't you something, a top-grade sucker. And how much did you give? Just curious. Heh-heh...
A check for a grand... So what now? If I see him, I'll crush the bastard.

I think it's already too late. He most likely slipped away. Few people have seen his face. He either walks around in a gas mask or a mask. Changed his suit, gave different personal details, and that's it. Who'll recognize him? But don't worry, we'll nail the bastard. I've got an idea.
And what about me? Sit around waiting for you to catch that goat? Compensation would be nice. You're the one who sent me to him. Promised a "royal haul". So you pay.
You're right there, can't argue with that... No cash right now, but I can offer a couple of artifacts. Sound good?
When there's no fish... anything will do.
Then it's settled. No hard feelings. You're not the first, won't be the last.
Ivan Sergeyevich asked to deliver a box of food supplies to Doctor Petrov. It smells very appetizing
Ivan Sergeyevich sent me for the package. For Petrov.
The one in Kishka? Our good Sergeyevich, always feeding everyone. But you can't feed everyone forever. The handout isn't endless.
Enough grumbling. If you've packed it, hand it over. If not, I'll come back later.
It's been packed for a while. Just been looking for a reliable courier. I know your kind. You'll eat any food as a snack.
I sniff with my sleeve, so don't worry.
Carry the box carefully. There are imported canned goods in glass jars.
I'll deliver it in perfect condition.
I almost forgot. Ivan Sergeyevich sent you a package.
A package?! Well, I'll be damned... And did he say what it was for?
He just asked me to deliver it. It was on my way, so I picked it up. Take it... smells very appetizing, by the way.
I really feel awkward... I should thank you somehow.
Oh, come on. You've already helped me a lot. Let's say we're even.
Wait, I can't do that... Here, take some medical supplies, they'll come in handy.
I'll take the meds. Always useful.
At Yantar, in the swamp, I found a PDA. Judging by everything, it's Vasilyev's PDA.
Really?! And why did you decide it's specifically his PDA?

Sakharov sent me to the swamp to look for traces of Vasilyev's group. I found a whole suit, tightly sealed. While I was examining it, something strange happened. Some kind of red flash and... nothing — no body, no suit, just the belongings. This PDA was there too. I listened to the recording and compared it. You can hear someone saying: "Sakharov is a coward, he's not responding!!!". Listen yourself — do you recognize this voice?

I don't know, I don't know... The recording is of poor quality, I wouldn't want to jump to conclusions. Could you leave it with me for a while? Besides that, there may be some scientific data on it. It will hardly be of interest to you.
I could even give it to you for good, but I'd like something in return. It didn't come easy to me.

I understand, I understand... A stalker-style... exchange. I'm having some financial difficulties, but I can offer a good specimen of a first-tier artifact. Artifacts with such properties, believe me, are extremely rare. I also have some anti-radiation drugs.
Alright, give me your artifact and the anti-rads.
I'd rather keep the PDA for myself, no offense.
Here you go. As stalkers say, the artifact is "all green".
That is your right.
Barman, why don't you buy tails, hooves, that sort of thing?

If there's an urgent order for some kind of mutant, then I'll take it. Otherwise, no. There's more hassle with it than profit. The stuff's perishable. Where am I supposed to store it in such quantities? You'd need a cold storage facility, plus a refrigerated truck to move it. Nothing but overhead costs. Artifacts are simpler and more reliable. And the profit is several times higher.
You sometimes see messages online about rare mutants. What if I manage to take one down? Their parts must be worth good money. What should I do? They'll just go to waste otherwise.

Well... if you bring parts from truly rare mutants, say from a Controller, a Giant, an Electrochimera, or a Poltergeist, then I'll take them. But don't expect big money, I'll tell you that right away. Otherwise... I'll repeat myself: I only take mutant parts on order. Sometimes, very rarely, for myself, but only for culinary purposes and in small quantities. As for the Swamps, the scientists there are interested in all kinds of guts, Sakharov from Yantar too. And who knows who else might need them. Ask around... And in general — nature should be protected. Heh-heh...
Yeah... When was the last time you went toward the Garbage, you conservationist?
Don't start teaching me where I should go... Better go look for artifacts instead of hauling around rotten meat. The bar's already full of rats as it is.
Anything else to make some money on?

In principle, yes... You already know that we managed to dig a passage into the Foggy Thicket. Strange place, I tell you, there's a bad smell coming from there. I can smell it — there's something there that should be greatly feared.
I've already heard about what's going on there. You're not the first. Get to the point.

Have you already dealt with our brave neighbors? I mean the mercenaries. We've got something like a truce with them right now. They're sitting quietly, peacefully, not bothering anyone. And that's suspicious. That gang didn't settle here for nothing — they're waiting for a signal, that's a fact.\nThere's information that somewhere in the northern part of the Foggy Thicket, those bastards set up and mothballed a base. They'll wait for reinforcements and then strike from two sides. It won't be pretty. We need that place scouted. What do you say?
And what about your brave and daring boys? Or are they fearless only in words, and when it comes down to it... they crap their pants?

I've got a hunch, Marked One, that there's one of their spies mixed in among us. I already reported my suspicions to Lukash, but he just waves it off. Like... says I should drink less.\nSo here's the thing — you're an outsider, hopefully nobody's tailing you. You come and go, who cares. You'll head into that thicket, take a quick look around, see what's what, and come back. If we send our own, they'll spend a week getting ready, then another week drinking to a successful raid. Not like the mercs — even the dogs on the Cordon would know who's going where.\nAnd when you get back, I'll either give you a recipe or pay you some cash. Then we'll celebrate.

Tavern-keeper, do you take me for a sucker? There's already horror going on in that thicket, and now you're sending me to certain death. What if there are mercs there? They'll finish me off in an instant, I won't even have time to squeak. And what good would your money be to me then?
Don't rush to die, Marked One. If there were anyone there, those sitting here would've stirred up long ago. But it's all quiet and peaceful. You've got to understand these things.
I understand it's a dead-end job. I've got a nose too.
Maybe you're right. What exactly needs to be done?
Then the conversation is over. And what we whispered about here must stay here.

Find their stash, look around — if there's anything valuable, bring it here. I'm especially interested in communication equipment. Without comms, they won't move anywhere. Mark the place in your PDA, then show it to me. That should be it... Oh, and take this for the road.
Shinkar asked me to investigate the northern part of the Foggy Thicket. Somewhere there should be a mothballed mercenary base. He is interested in communication equipment that must be brought back
I had a hunch I'd get set up, I really did!
What are you making noise for? Alive and well — what more do you need?
What did you say — "peace and quiet, nobody stirring"? There were no fewer than a dozen mercenaries guarding that base.
If there'd been a dozen of them, you'd be full of holes. And you don't look like someone who overcame superior enemy forces in an uneven fight.
You're always joking. But the mercs were there — maybe not a dozen, fewer, but that doesn't make it any easier, especially when they come at you from behind.
I already get that you're a hero. Did you find anything?
You were right. Their base is there — I'll mark the place on the map. I grabbed a radio, barely dragged it back. There are also crates with weapons and food left, but I couldn't carry them alone.

That's obvious — no way to haul it all alone. No worries, we'll equip a small expedition for that. Now Lukash won't be able to brush it off. He'll organize a squad to retrieve the ownerless property in no time.
I'll take my recipe now and be on my way — I'm tired.
Then write it down. It'll make a magnificent artifact.
Transfer the money already and I'll be on my way — I'm tired.
Everything as agreed, proper and correct.
M-m-m... Friend, help me... Damn it, why did I...
O-ka-a-ay... What happened to you?

Was resting here by the campfire... A snork jumped me... Tore my leg up, the bastard... I need some kind of stimulant. Otherwise I won't crawl to where I need to go. You don't happen to have a standard scientific medkit? They've got good painkillers and proper disinfectants.\nIt hurts like hell, damn it...
Scientific? Yeah, I've got one.
No scientific one. Will an army medkit do?
Only got a basic medkit. Still better than nothing.
Sorry, I don't have any meds. Hold on, I'll bring some. I'll try not to be long.

Much obliged... Whew, what a relief! Pity it won't last long... But now I'll definitely make it to the Bar.\nAnd this is for you — a few rounds, for not sparing a medkit for a stranger. What do they call you, savior?
Still a relief! Pity it won't last long... But it should be enough to reach the Bar.\nAnd this is for you — a few rounds, for not sparing a medkit for a stranger. What do they call you, savior?
A bit easier, sure! But it's like a bandage on a corpse... I'll try to make it to the Bar. There's someone there.\nWhat do they call you, friend?
They call me the Marked One. And you don't really look like a stalker. How did you end up here, and without any meds?

Nice to meet you, Marked One! You're right, I'm not a stalker... Well, not exactly. I work for government agencies. Callsign "Seraphim-12". So that's what you can call me.
And I did have medical supplies, and good ones. Probably no one around here has ever seen medicine like that...
I ditched it, along with almost all my cargo. In the Wild Territory, zombified stalkers pinned me down in a tunnel with fire anomalies — barely fought my way out. But all my gear burned up.
Only the scanners I was tasked with installing survived.
Scanners? What for?
Scanners? What for? And how did you even get here from the Wild Territory?

Basically, an operation is being planned to penetrate deeper into the Zone. It'll be carried out by our people together with foreign special services. Beforehand, remotely, they want to track all possible problems... They issued scanners for anomalous activity and ordered us to install them in a certain grid inside the Zone. I've already installed two, three more left. But looks like it's not meant to be now...\nYeah, they're going to drill my brain out over this... I already took the advance.\nListen, maybe you could install them? I'll reward you! No doubt about it! So, what do you say? Just keep in mind — the scanners need to be installed quickly. You'll have five days for each scanner. No more.

You can get onto an old road not far from here, it leads to the Rostok plant's railway depot. Head strictly east from this spot, to a fence with broken gates — the road starts just beyond it. I'll mark it on your PDA, just in case.
As for the scanners... Basically, an operation is being planned to penetrate deeper into the Zone. It'll be carried out by our people together with foreign special services. Beforehand, remotely, they want to track all possible problems... They issued scanners for anomalous activity and ordered us to install them in a certain grid inside the Zone. I've already installed two, three more left. But looks like it's not meant to be now...
Yeah, they're going to drill my brain out over this... I already took the advance.
Listen, maybe you could install them? I'll reward you! No doubt about it! So, what do you say? Just keep in mind — the scanners need to be installed quickly. You'll have five days for each scanner. No more.
I could help... But where are your scanners?
One's with me, two more I left at the Bar — they're heavy as hell. If you install this one, find me there and we'll talk about the rest. Take it.
Yeah... Heavy. Oh well. Where and how do I install it?

Look, installation is simple as can be: place it exactly at the designated point and it starts working automatically. For this scanner, the installation area isn't far from here. North of the forest there's a spot — satellite data shows a large mass of metal there. Maybe some kind of installation? Anyway, try to place it as precisely as possible right here. See the marker on the map?
Yeah, I see it, not too far. I'll give it a try then. And good luck getting there.
I'll be waiting for you at the Bar.
Sorry, friend, I've already got problems up to my neck.
Then I'll look for someone in the Bar, maybe someone will agree to help. If I don't find anyone in a couple of days, I'll have to head back.
Take care... Serafim. Maybe we'll meet again.
Hello! Marked One. As you can see, I'm getting back on my feet.
Anything else? If not, I'm heading to the Bar. We'll meet there.
Anything else?
How's life, Marked One? How's the loot?
Little by little... You're still here? I thought that was it — you'd already flown off.
Hey there. Listen, Serafim, I'm heading deeper into the Zone anyway, I can set up your scanners.

Excellent! Because nobody around here wants to take it on... Just keep in mind, they're heavy, and you'll have to haul it a long way. If you set this one up, we'll talk about the rest. Here you go... Well?
No need anymore... I found a stalker who agreed to install all the remaining scanners. And I'm packing my things. Heading back soon. No hard feelings, all right.
Yeah... Heavy. Oh well, where and how do I set it up?
Whoa, shit! No, Serafim, take it back. I can't lug something this heavy.

Look, installation's simple as can be: you place it exactly at the designated spot and it starts working automatically. For this scanner, the installation area is in the Red Forest. There's a place up north — satellite imagery shows a large mass of metal there. Maybe some kind of installation? Anyway, try to be as precise as possible at this exact spot. See the marker on the map?\nIf you manage to install the scanner within five days — that'll be great.
Maybe I'll find someone either stronger... or greedier. Take care, Marked One.
Yeah, I see it. I'm moving out.
I've installed the first scanner. I can set up the others.

Thank you so much! Here, take the second one, it needs to be installed in the territory of the so-called "Tesla" zone... I don't know what exactly was there, but the installation point is located in this spot. There's no serious rush with the timing, but it's better not to drag it out... If you install the scanner within five days, that would be very good.\nAnd... Marked One, here's a small compensation from me.

Thank you. I ran into a stalker who agreed to install the remaining scanners, so... sorry about that...\nHere, Marked One, take this from me for your help. And I'm packing my things. Heading back soon.
"Tesla Zone"... Is there any way to get there?
I see... I'm on my way.

You can get there, through Limansk, straight north, I think you won't miss it. I'll send you the transition point. But not everyone who went there managed to come back alive and well. Supposedly the electricity hits so hard there it's no joke. And in some places there are high-frequency electromagnetic fields — you can get fried like in a microwave. This isn't a "Burner" anomaly — you can't just drop your suit and run. There, the energy burns you from the inside.
Have you been there yourself?

Never had the chance. If I had, I'd have installed the scanner myself already. I've heard stories from those who were there... They saw some weird large, round contraptions. They say that's what caused all of this. Knowledgeable guides claim that there actually is a more or less safe path there. But where exactly it is, I don't know. Ask around — maybe you'll get lucky and find out.
Got it... I'll ask around. I'm on my way.
Hello, Seraphim. I've installed the second scanner. If needed, I can put up a third one as well.

I respect people whose word is their bond! Here, take the third one. It needs to be installed in a place the local stalkers call the Red Forest. It's on Radar, right at this point. As far as we know, the Brain Scorcher doesn't reach the installation site, so you shouldn't worry too much... It would be good if you manage to install it within five days.\nAnd a little gift for a job well done...

I respect people whose word is their bond! I ran into one of Ivar's men, he'd been in the vicinity of the Brain Scorcher and agreed to install the last scanner...\nHere, take this from me for the help...
Radar... A dangerous place... Well, I'll try, but I won't promise anything.

If you install the scanner on time and I receive confirmation that it's operational, I'll stay in the Bar for another day — I've already lingered here longer than planned. So hurry back once you're done. Good luck.
I've installed the third scanner.

Yes, I've been informed that all the scanners I was supposed to install are functioning. Thank you for the work, on behalf of all humanity, and from me personally as well. Please accept this too, as a small compensation.
Yeah. You sure like playing with words. But thanks... I'll be going.

Hold on... Over at Yantar, some nerd managed—don't ask me how—to dig up information on a certain recipe. Sorry I didn't remember it right away, had other things on my mind. I'm no expert in this stuff, but among stalkers, as I understand it, such information is in high demand. That nerd swore, though he was drunk at the time, that if you cook up some artifact using that recipe, you can practically walk around the Tesla in your underwear. I'll send it to your PDA, and after that it's up to you.\nAnd I also heard, out of the corner of my ear, that you're looking for Ghost?

Hold on... I was packing my things, it's time for me to head home. I don't need a second weapons loadout anymore, so take the rifle and the ammo for it.\nAnd I also heard, out of the corner of my ear, that you're looking for Ghost?
Ghost? I am. Have you seen him or know something?

Just a couple of days after you saved me in the Red Forest, I ran into him. And he was heading—at least that was the talk—to the Tesla. Why the hell did he go there? Whether that helps you or not, I don't know.
Slippery one. To the Tesla, then... Farewell, Seraphim-12.
Mmm...
What?
You... Who? Why...
What? I don't understand... Who are you?
I... Ivar... No strength. No desires. None of it was needed. In vain. Pressing...
Ivar? You're the one I need. Don't rush, calm down a bit. I'm Marked One. You're Ivar. Let's try to talk. Alright? Say something if you understand.
Yes... Marked One... Hard to speak. Let's try...
So here's the thing: I was on Radar, thought it gets shut down there. Poked at some switches, and then it... Damn it! I should probably keep it simpler.\nIvar, did you shut down the "Brain Scorcher"?
Mmm... Yes... No... Mine... There, underground... Strelok... Gave diagrams, blueprints, plans... Don't remember. In vain... He asked... shouldn't have...
Strelok gave you the diagrams? And where is he himself?

Yes... Diagrams, maps... he had them. Don't know... where from... He left... Asked not to do it. Not to shut it down. Dangerous... He turned it on... There was no other way... I didn't understand back then...
What did he ask you not to do? Not to shut down the "Brain Scorcher", right? But why?
There, beyond Radar, something... He was suppressing it... With radiation. I didn't understand... It was hard to grasp...

Yeah, well. And I don't understand you. So on Radar, Strelok turned on the "Brain Scorcher"? That's nonsense. How is that even possible? What was he trying to suppress with radiation? And how did he know?
Tired... Get to the point...
Alright, sorry. What's beyond Radar, up north?
Monolith... That's what he called it... Creates a field... of powerlessness, apathy... Drives people mad. Illusions... Expanding. It'll get worse for everyone...
Monolith? That's all just fairy tales... Alright, that's not the point. Strelok's diagrams. Where did he get them and where are they now?

Don't know... where from. Later... about that. I'm getting worse... Listen, while I still can... talk.\nThe scientists. They can tell... more about the "Rainbow"... It must be turned on... The scientists. There. In the city. In the Ivankovsky District Center. Go... He said... And I didn't believe him... Mmmm...
District Center? Which District Center?
Yes, yes... There. Go...
So, the Ivankovsky District Center. If only I knew how to get there.
Start the Brain Scorcher

As it turned out, the radiation from the installation on Radar, while preventing stalkers from advancing north, at the same time helped contain the spread of a certain field of powerlessness and apathy coming from somewhere in the center of the Zone, possibly from the station itself. It is necessary to restart the "Brain Scorcher" as soon as possible, otherwise I fear that the entire Zone will become deserted very soon. Or something even worse may happen. Easy to say — "restart the Brain Scorcher". But how is that to be done?

First things first, I need to find a way into the Ivankovsky District Center. From Ivar's words, I understood that a group of scientists is stationed there. They may be able to share details about how the "Brain Scorcher" works. This installation is also known by another name — the "Rainbow".
Hard... Can't...
Yeah, I get it... Rest.
Mmm...
How are you?
Seems to be letting go. A doctor came, helped... And I... have I seen you somewhere before?

Of course you have — you sent me to the scientists in the Ivankovsky District Center, remember? Though you were barely speaking then. And now too.\nOr do you think we met earlier? Do you know who I am?
No... I don't understand myself. You reminded me of someone... well, anyway... That can't be... You can't be him...
I see. You're rambling again. You still don't look too good...\nAbout the information Strelok shared with you. You said we'd talk about it later. So what was it and where from?

I don't know exactly where from. There was all sorts... Diagrams, plans, blueprints, maps. Looks like it all came from some underground complex. I shared something with him too... Materials from my work... I wanted to understand... I thought zombies came from the "Brain Scorcher"... But the "Brain Scorcher" is gone, and there are new zombies... Even more... So it was all for nothing...\nStrelok said... the Monolith emits something, that's why there are zombies and psy...chic... disor...ders. I didn't believe him... Thought it was fairy tales... The Monolith and its call... Thought it was some illness... But he said the field of "apathy" overla...ys... the "Brain Scorcher"... Deliberately so. I realized on myself that it was true... Barely got away... Hard...
You got lucky. Don't worry so much, you start slurring your words.\nBetter not get distracted — let's talk about Strelok.

At our last meeting... he left me notes... of a completely different kind. So that I would understand why... I gave everything to the Doctor... In case I didn't make it... It's all there. Why it's on... And why it must not be turned off. I thought it was a mistake... He said something about modulation... That it doesn't let it... And now... Anyway, it absolutely has to be turned on... Even if not in that, then in another modu...lation...

If only I knew how to do that. Fedotov, the head guy from the Ivankovsky District Center, told me there's a control post on Radar. But it turns out it's not where I was, in another place. Where did you shut the installation down?

On Radar. From the fork on the road north... Until you run into the slope of a hill... There's an airlock there... But I didn't shut it down... Stayed outside... Monitored the radiation level on the instruments... Guys from my group shut it down... They all stayed there... Now there's no power. And the doors are blo...cked... Probably on purpose... Or by mistake... But there must be a backup... power source for sure.
Fedotov also mentioned some underground base in Dark Valley. The staff from the "Rainbow" supposedly lived there and, possibly, some of the complex systems were controlled from there.
Among Strelok's papers... there was something about that... Find the Doctor... Read them... He headed to the Foggy Thicket from me.

I've been looking to meet him myself for a long time. He promised to let me know when we could see each other, but so far, nothing. The Thicket, you say? I'll try to find him there myself. Get better.

Some things are starting to become clearer regarding the "Rainbow", but for the full picture I need to talk to the Doctor and take Strelok's papers from him. Ivar said that Doc visited him in the Bar quite recently, after which he headed to the Foggy Thicket.
Marked One? Finally... Have you been to the Doctor? Got the papers?
Yes — the answer to both questions. Why are you so worked up?\nListen, I can't wrap my head around this... Is it really true? Everything that's written there... About the Monolith, about the madmen.
It's me. I don't have time now, I'll come back later.

I first took it for... fantasy myself. But compared things... It matches too well. We need to turn the "Brain Scorcher" back on... That's why I'm worried — right now you're the only one... who can do it... It's important that you believe...

Alright, let's say I turn the installation on, and then what? The field of powerlessness will stop spreading, but the "fragment carriers" will remain. That means it won't solve the main problem, it'll only delay it. Break through to the Monolith? And then what? And how do you even get to it, if even Strelok couldn't? Or did he manage after all?

Ghost, Strelok's closest associate... I think he might know... Or suspect. They talked a lot with Strelok... but for some reason nothing worked out for Strelok... And you have a chance. At least, that's how it seems to me...

This Ghost... First he still needs to be found and persuaded to tell what he knows about all this.\nAnd in general, if you think about it: do I even need this? Did I sign up to be some hero-savior of humanity, to storm the CNPP, or wherever that Monolith is? And it's funny to say — there I am, standing before the Monolith, which isn't even material, if you believe the notes, but just a projection... How do you make it stop affecting our world? Nooo, turning the installation on — that at least makes some sense why it's done, but after that...
Let it be like that for now... Turn it on first... Then, maybe, your own motive will appear... To look for the Monolith... And then we'll see...
We'll see... as usual. Alright, I'll sort through the papers and plan how to pull this off.
What's going on with the "Brain Scorcher", Marked One? Any progress?
Not yet. Working on it. Don't get nervous, most important thing — it's bad for you. I think it'll work out.
What's going on with the "Brain Scorcher", Marked One? Any progress?
By all accounts, it looks like I managed to start it, but there's no full certainty yet. Time will tell.
The main thing is that you did it. Not even for everyone, but for yourself personally.

Personally... probably. I've still got business in the Zone, after all. Didn't want to get wiped out on some next run because of all those apathy fields.\nAnd you, I see, have come to your senses. Almost lively. Listen, Ivar, I've been meaning to ask for a long time: why does your group have such a name — "Seekers"? What are you looking for, if it's not a secret?

We are looking for ways to return zom... zom...bified and those obsessed with the Monolith fragment to a normal state. Sorry, my speech function hasn't fully recovered yet, so I pronounce some words poorly.\nAt first I used purely medi...cal methods, but quickly realized they don't help. Then I switched to searching for artifacts with special properties... That's when my first "followers" appeared. But here too we failed. Then I started considering the option of shutting down the "Rainbow". It was quite a long stage. Many left the group, only the most steadfast remained. And, well, you know the result... Almost everyone died. And that's my fault. But, as pompous as it may sound, I am obliged to continue, obliged to succeed, so that their deaths were not in vain.

A worthy cause. All I can do is wish you good luck. But aren't the zombified just empty walking shells? In Strelok's notes it was said that the Monolith "empties" them and "absorbs the soul", whatever that is supposed to mean.

Maybe that's how it is. Some even justify their vile experiments with that. Saying it's the same as dissec... ting a corpse. But from a purely medical point of view, they still remain living people. And I think it's possible to somehow make the Monolith reject their absorbed... mind? Essence? Soul? Call it what you like. And then it will return to the empty shell.
There's probably something to that... Alright, it's time for me to go.

Don't rush. I haven't properly thanked you yet. You took a big risk with the "Brain Scorcher"...\nWhen I was heading back from Radar, I dropped part of my gear in the forest... near a crashed helicopter... there's a backpack there.\nIt was hard to carry it... there's plenty of wildlife all around. If you find it — it's yours. If not — sorry, I can't give you anything else for now.

Don't rush. I haven't properly thanked you yet. You took a big risk with the "Brain Scorcher"...\nWhen I was heading back from Radar, I dropped part of my gear... where there's a hole in the fence... a ladder... there's a backpack there.\nIt was hard to carry it... there's plenty of wildlife all around. If you find it — it's yours. If not — sorry, I can't give you anything else for now.

Don't rush. I haven't properly thanked you yet. You took a big risk with the "Brain Scorcher"...\nWhen I was heading back from Radar, I dropped part of my gear in the forest... where there's a hole in the fence... a big tree by the cliff ... there's a backpack there.\nIt was hard to carry it... there's plenty of wildlife all around. If you find it — it's yours. If not — sorry, I can't give you anything else for now.
There's probably something to it... I was just thinking here... Did you know Fang?
I did. What does Fang have to do with it?

He had a similar problem... As far as I know, he fell under the influence of a controller. The Doctor saved him and brought him to... a secluded place. It's in the undergrounds beneath the Agroprom Research Institute. That's where I met him. If he tried to get to the surface, he immediately became, well, like a zombie — exactly so. But as long as he stayed underground, he seemed normal.
You say "became", "was"... What happened to him? Did he recover?

Sakharov made some kind of special protective helmet. I brought it to Fang and he was able to go up to the surface wearing it. Sakharov suggested that a helicopter pick him up at Agroprom and take him somewhere they could help him, but I had my doubts...
So did he make it out or not?

He did, but to a different place. It's a long story. Right now he's in the Foggy Thicket, basically. And now I'm thinking whether I did the right thing arranging it all like that. Who's going to help him in that thicket now? He could've been under the supervision of doctors and scientists...

No! Anything but those scientists! You'd have just delivered them a new test... subject. Do you really think they would've treated him? Like hell they would! More likely, they'd try to make sure Fang stayed half-zombified for as long as possible. To thoroughly study, for example, how his body reacts to ther... mal burns, or puncture wounds, or severe dehydration... After they'd had their "fun" with physiology, they'd move on to the psyche. And then they'd really go all out, you can believe me. Of course, all for noble goals. "One innocent sacrifice to save thousands" and all that kind of crap. Pfah, hypocrites! In short, you did everything right, don't doubt it...

Hey, calm down! You can't go on like that. You really worked yourself up. In any case, I wanted to ask you to visit Fang in the thicket. You're probably the best specialist in this field in the entire Zone right now.
Of course, I'll go see him. Even if I didn't know him, it would be my medical duty. As soon as I fully recover and regain my strength, I'll head out right away. Where should I look for him?
Find the Doctor. He'll tell you the details and guide you to the shelter where Fang lives. And now it's time for me to go. We'll see each other again.
Hello, my friend.
